-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:64
Sender:"Zofia Nowakowski" <ZNowakowski@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-08 11:58:42
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] planning board meeting
Message:

Update on tonights planning board meeting, 7:30pm at City Hall.  It is expected to be very short, and cover 3 amendments:
- to government district redevelopment plan
- to Henry Oliver redevelopment plan
- to downtown development district renewal area.

The major project, the Heldrich Center 15-story building planned for Livingston and George - to include convention center, luxury apts, hotel has been pulled for site plan approval, because they are revising the plans and those plans are not in yet.  The current proposal packet for site plan approval (no variances must be requested) is available in the planning office from 8:30-4:30 for public review.

Zofia

Zofia Nowakowski
Fiscal Policy Institute
218 W 40th St, 3rd Fl
New York, NY 10018
Tel: 212.278.0878
Fax:212.730.1405





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:65
Sender:xavier.hansen@...
Post Date/Time:2000-03-08 15:30:58
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] WE MUST GO TO THE PEOPLE!
Message:

A message from the Steering Committee:

Sisters & Brothers,

We need ALL OF YOU to come and take part in the week-end 
door-to-door canvass of the New Brunswick Community. 
Everyone is working hard and the campaign is growing by 
the minute. Several community figures (preachers, 
lawyers,...) have contacted us in the past week to get 
involved...BUT WE MUST CONTINUE TO REACH OUT TO THE 
PEOPLE! So far the Outreach Committee can only count on 
a half a dozen canvassers (less than 20% of some 40 
activists in the campaign). There are some 48,000 
eligible voters in the city, many of whom have never 
voted. We need EVERYONE to help if we are to get all of 
the people involved. Try it out and you'll be amazed at 
how empowering it is to talk to people about uniting to 
seize actual political power and transform the city. 
This is no run-of-the-mill please-give-a-dollar-to-my-
cause operation. Come and find out.
We call it the "People's Campaign" because we want the 
people to learn to organize themselves to seize 
political power. This is not possible if they don't know 
about the campaign in the first place. All of us who 
work on the Media, Fundraising, Right to Know and/or 
Steering Committee NEED TO REACH OUT TO THE PEOPLE in 
order to do our job for the campaign - how else do we 
know what to write on our flyers, how to present our 
research, what kind of events people want to take part 
in?
At the very least, everyone should come canvass one 
Saturday or Sunday each month. If your schedule makes it 
very difficult, come for ONE HOUR and talk to the people 
(especially the Afro-American and Latino workers who 
have been kept out of any political power by the Machine 
forever).

The Canvassers meet every Saturday at 1PM and every 
Sunday at 12 Noon at the New Brunswick Public Library.   
For more info, call Sam Prince at 565-0199.

This is not an intellectual exercise.
We're in it to win it. So let's act like it.

X-man.





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:66
Sender:Keith Joseph <lknesta@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-09 00:15:24
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Pimp Cops and their judge friend
Message:

In today's paper you may or may not have seen that Judge Hoffman
listened to officers Marshall and Chinchilla defense attorney's ask for
a dismissal.  You may remember these infamous officers for the fake
shooting that they staged in front of my home a few months ago, which
was followed by the wholesale arrests of young Afro-American men.  Or
you may know these cops for thier lucrative prositution ring or drug
dealing activities.  Judge Hoffman should have resigned from this case
since he is incapable of imaprialty telling reporters that "I like Jim
Marshal, he is a friend of mine".  I would like to know if Judge Hoffman
is a client of officer Marshall.  We should use this opportunity to
expose the need for elected judges, elected police review boards, and
the source of much of the crime in New Brunswick: the police department.

Post ID:68
Sender:Brian Villa <villa@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-09 05:03:25
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Re: Pimp Cops and their judge friend
Message:

It would be nice if some people FINALLY started writing letters to the 
editor in the Star-Ledger and Home News Tribune. ACTIONS speak louder 
than words. And after TWO MONTHS of hearing "we're gonna do this" and 
"we're gonna do that," and being nearly  yes'd to death --and more-- 
not one semicolon has shown up this these mediums.

If you're going to raise awareness, do so in a mediums that people 
actually read and subscribe to. This is part of the praxis of winning.

"Actus reus uber mens reus."

--BV





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:69
Sender:"kristina bas" <krisbas@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-09 09:57:55
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Fundraising meeting
Message:

hello everyone,

i volunteered to put together a summary of Sunday night's fundraising 
meeting so all can keep aware of our end of things:

Attending: Kristina Bas, Frank Bright, Curtis Warren

1- adhering to formal NJ Elec (Election Law Enforcement Commission) 
paperwork (ie. creation of PAC, reporting of funds, etc) is now underway.

2- we have begun the first steps in creating campaign buttons/T-Shirts for 
sale, logos to be approved at next Steering committee meeting (which i 
believe they were)

* NOTE: to all people's campaign activists: if you know of anyone or you 
yourself are a designer, artist, whatever, who'd like to create a design(s) 
for potential campaign T-Shirts, please let me know. I have some ideas about 
designs but alas i'm not much for designing myself.

in addition to using the official logo of the campaign (which i don't think 
has been decided on yet) i'd like to create some hip campaign wear for the 
youth and other groups that wouldn't otherwise purchase the normal political 
tee (e.g. actually create t-shirts in size small and medium for smaller 
framed people)

of course, all logos and designs, i imagine, will be approved by the 
Steering committee.

3- we are investigating a potential Hip hop party fundraiser.

4- we will be having a RAFFLE, for drawing on April 21st. further details to 
be announced but keep in mind that we would like everyone to sell mountains 
and mountains of them....

5- potential big money fundraising dinners, to be planned for the future...

6- we are trying to get started a weekly people's campaign institution that 
will serve two functions: raising money and raising awareness. something 
small and low maintenance, but which begins to get the campaign into the 
minds of people in the community. Example: a weekly juice stand; weekly 
cheap vegetarian hot dinners; a weekly book sale via the campaign 
BookMOBILE; movie night, etc.

please forward your ideas to me as well. remember, the trick is LOW 
MAINTENANCE, and HIGH VISIBILITY. this may sound impossible at first, but i 
have faith....

IN addition, if anyone has any ideas in terms of big fundraising activities 
(E.G. a square dance, whatever!) please forward them to me. we want to 
organize events that address the diverse segments of new brunswick. So, if 
you know any hip hop artists (or other performers) personally who would be 
interested in performing, please let me know.
Also, we are in DIRE need of potential VENUES. so if your uncle's sister's 
cousin owns an auditorium or tavern somewhere and would be happy to let us 
use it, please let me know.

AND of course, we need people to participate in fundraising meetings. and 
i'm not talking about those of you who already attend 5.2 meetings per week. 
new blood.... fundraising....new faces....fundraising...

remember: it won't work without money (unfortunately!)

peace,

Kristina

Post ID:70
Sender:"paul mcgee" <shorepaulie@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-09 10:44:12
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Re: Pimp Cops and their judge friend
Message:

On top of that, Judge Hoffman gave made prejudicial comments to the 
prosecution against their case. He said: "If you decide who did it in the 
beginning, you can only build up a case to justify that position."

>From: Keith Joseph <lknesta@...>
>Reply-To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>To: "nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com" <nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com>
>Subject: [nbpeoplescampaign] Pimp Cops and their judge friend
>Date: Thu, 09 Mar 2000 00:15:24 -0500
>
>In today's paper you may or may not have seen that Judge Hoffman
>listened to officers Marshall and Chinchilla defense attorney's ask for
>a dismissal.  You may remember these infamous officers for the fake
>shooting that they staged in front of my home a few months ago, which
>was followed by the wholesale arrests of young Afro-American men.  Or
>you may know these cops for thier lucrative prositution ring or drug
>dealing activities.  Judge Hoffman should have resigned from this case
>since he is incapable of imaprialty telling reporters that "I like Jim
>Marshal, he is a friend of mine".  I would like to know if Judge Hoffman
>is a client of officer Marshall.  We should use this opportunity to
>expose the need for elected judges, elected police review boards, and
>the source of much of the crime in New Brunswick: the police department.
>

Post ID:71
Sender:Jess <jswant@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-09 12:19:00
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Re: Fundraising meeting
Message:

> 2- we have begun the first steps in creating campaign buttons/T-Shirts for 
> sale, logos to be approved at next Steering committee meeting (which i 
> believe they were)

Yes Great!  We were talking about this at last night's Media Committe
meeting (minutes to be posted shortly).  I think it's great that both
committees are seeing that this is a great idea...and taking action to
make it happen.  

There is a question though:  We don't want to have 2 committees invest
energy in this when that time and effort can be spent elsewhere.  I would
venture to say that coming up with the design and making contacts is the
media committee's area, as it is a walking billboard.  I can be completely
wrong about this - let's discuss.

I was in the process of doing research into places to get the t-shirts
printed up as well as starting to come up with designs, etc.  I don't know
if I should keep doing this. Maybe we can collaborate on each committee's
efforts.

Again, let's discuss who should field this one (sorry for the corporate
talk, I'm at work :) ).  Let's not needlessly waste anyone's effort :)

Wow...good thing that those minutes came out!  

Thanks!

Jessie

>than words. And after TWO MONTHS of hearing "we're gonna do this" and

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:73
Sender:"Zofia Nowakowski" <ZNowakowski@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-09 19:24:27
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] logo and website
Message:

Guys, hate me but Im putting this out here.  I think it is great that we have people on board designing our logo. This is a great gift. I feel very strongly against using the top logo, the people stomping on fat white cops and bureaucrats.  I think we would be cutting ourselves off at the knees if we did.  If we cant use the bottom one because of DSA (is this right) it would be great to have another to choose from.  I feel very strongly that we need to present ourselves as a constructive, forward moving group, rather than destructive and antagonistic.  I think we should focus on eliminating the current system of government, policy decisions, lack of representation and machine, rather than a campaign that focuses on attacking individual people.  Of couse, there will always be some crossover.  The tone of the first provides an inviting environment to newcomers, the tone of the second does not.

Maybe we can have one main logo and a few other logo/images that we use when it seems right.  Can we at least run a vote on the images across all our people on the membership list, both on and off email?  The point is an image is a powerful thing, it represents all of us, and just as we voted on our name I think we should vote on our logo.

I ran the top logo by a coworker who has created an organization inthe lower east side (The Lower East Side Collective) that was crucial in the recent local district elections and part of a coalition that staged a long, drawn-out, successful community-labor campaign that won a union for illegal immigrant greengrocers in their community. Prior to this she was active in the PIRGS.  I know I am a tightass so I needed a second opinion.  Her comments:

With this logo, we are going to get those that are politicized, those that are already communist.  But if our real goal is to reach a broader audience of people who arent politically active right now, regular folks, they'll probably be turned off.  If we are serious about building political power, we need to reach people we havent yet reached by the left.  This kind of imagery doesnt sell.

Zofia

Zofia Nowakowski
Fiscal Policy Institute
218 W 40th St, 3rd Fl
New York, NY 10018
Tel: 212.278.0878
Fax:212.730.1405





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:74
Sender:CHRIS KOZLOWSKI <CKOZLOWSKI@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-09 21:59:51
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] website domain name
Message:

Awww... what's wrong with darkcartel.com?  ;)


In all seriousness, we have been discussing some potential domain names to
register.  
peoplescampaign.org is taken, as is newbrunswick.org (unfortunately, that
would have been a lot of fun :) ) We could undoubtedly get
nbpeoplescampaign.org, but that seems very convoluted.  nbpc.org is also
taken.   I could potentially look into the new freestyle domain names, but I
am not sure how those work.  I will investigate the potential.  In the
meanwhile, any other suggestions would be great.

Chris


-----Original Message-----
From: Zofia Nowakowski
To: CKOZLOWSKI@...
Sent: 3/9/00 7:26 PM
Subject: website

Another tightass Q.  Can we get a url that is different from darkcartel?

Z

Zofia Nowakowski

New York, NY 10018

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:75
Sender:CHRIS KOZLOWSKI <CKOZLOWSKI@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-09 22:21:17
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Re: logo and website
Message:

First of all, allow me to express my pleasure at seeing actual discussion on
this list.  This is what we need more of, in all forms and coming from
progressives of all stripes -- dialogue.  Every bit of input, no matter how
benign or controversial, gives us more to think about and understand.  It
also brings us closer to each other, to understanding our respective
positions, and further down the path to an effective united front.

We had a discussion before at the Media Committee regarding the logo prior
to the two concepts were submitted.  The discussion was over the logo that
appeared on the last flyer for the convention, which contained an upraised
fist.  That logo was basically just clip art, it was not meant to be
permanent by any means.  But it was said that this would not do, because it
was somewhat overplayed, and people had many associations with it that would
result in the same effect you are concerned about.  

At the same time, we recognized that we were in fact in this with an
explicit message.  That message has everything to do with reclaiming
democracy from the cops and the bureaucrats, and doing it through both unity
(thus the symbolism of the people on top holding hands) and contempt for
social injustice and the corrupt 'representatives' who enable it to
flourish.  In no way does the logo inherently suggest 'communism' -- I
honestly don't know where that one came from.  And the people on the bottom
do not give me the appearance of being stomped on.  But I suppose it might
be somewhat like a Rorscharch of sorts... ;)

There are a great many people from diverse social strata who I associate
with on a regular basis.  It honestly does not take being terribly
politicized to see the blood and dirt on the hands of the establishment and
the corporate interests.  Those who choose to close their eyes to it to the
point of being antagonized by the logo itself, do not seem likely to be the
type to get involved in any case.

I would also like to hear suggestions with regard to content of an alternate
logo from those who share Zofia's view, so that I can pass them on to Mike
and we can put together some alternatives before a vote.

To those of you who haven't seen the logo, visit http://151.198.10.71

-----Original Message-----
From: Zofia Nowakowski
To: Nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
Sent: 3/9/00 7:24 PM
Subject: [nbpeoplescampaign] logo and website

Guys, hate me but Im putting this out here.  I think it is great that we
have people on board designing our logo. This is a great gift. I feel
very strongly against using the top logo, the people stomping on fat
white cops and bureaucrats.  I think we would be cutting ourselves off
at the knees if we did.  If we cant use the bottom one because of DSA
(is this right) it would be great to have another to choose from.  I
feel very strongly that we need to present ourselves as a constructive,
forward moving group, rather than destructive and antagonistic.  I think
we should focus on eliminating the current system of government, policy
decisions, lack of representation and machine, rather than a campaign
that focuses on attacking individual people.  Of couse, there will
always be some crossover.  The tone of the first provides an inviting
environment to newcomers, the tone of the second does not.

Maybe we can have one main logo and a few other logo/images that we use
when it seems right.  Can we at least run a vote on the images across
all our people on the membership list, both on and off email?  The point
is an image is a powerful thing, it represents all of us, and just as we
voted on our name I think we should vote on our logo.

I ran the top logo by a coworker who has created an organization inthe
lower east side (The Lower East Side Collective) that was crucial in the
recent local district elections and part of a coalition that staged a
long, drawn-out, successful community-labor campaign that won a union
for illegal immigrant greengrocers in their community. Prior to this she
was active in the PIRGS.  I know I am a tightass so I needed a second
opinion.  Her comments:

With this logo, we are going to get those that are politicized, those
that are already communist.  But if our real goal is to reach a broader
audience of people who arent politically active right now, regular
folks, they'll probably be turned off.  If we are serious about building
political power, we need to reach people we havent yet reached by the
left.  This kind of imagery doesnt sell.

Zofia

Zofia Nowakowski
Fiscal Policy Institute
218 W 40th St, 3rd Fl
New York, NY 10018
Tel: 212.278.0878
Fax:212.730.1405

Post ID:76
Sender:"Nicole Adler" <nicoleadler@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-09 23:57:52
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] MINUTES COME THROUGH!!!!
Message:

I think we have seen the impact that communication through this listserv can 
afford...  as jess said, the media committee was also ruminating the t-shirt 
idea, but without further ado, the media minutes:

MINUTES FOR 3/8 MEDIA COMMITTEE MEETING

In attendance:  Keith, Errrrrrric, Nikki, Jess, Chris and Jim

PROGRESS:
-Chris and Jess come through on the start of our web page!!!  CHECK IT 
OUT!!!  It comes complete with a discussion board--so let's get to 
discussing!  We discussed the fact that we need to get other committees to 
submit info for the web page, preferably in e-form.
-There were two logos submitted by Mike the Wanderer, the favorite of the 
media committee was the one with the people holding a banner.  Jess is going 
to fix the logo so that it will fit on letterhead.  WE NEED INPUT FROM OTHER 
COMMITTEES ABOUT WHICH LOGO IS FAVORED! (thank you Zophia)
-Nikki is working on getting info for advertising in larger formats, like 
billboards.
-Keith finished the flyer for the caravan in April.
-The flyer request form will be put on the web page in the next couple of 
days, so that people can submit their requests via the net, REMEMBER 
REQUESTS ARE DUE ONE WEEK PRIOR TO NEED!
-Jim's letter to student and community organizations about the People's 
Campaign is complete and will be sent out next week.  Jim is also working on 
   a letter to the editor about the campaign.
-We also discussed the newsletter that the Steering Committee discussed.  It 
will be a 4-page newsletter in English and Spanish.  We will be in contact 
with Right-to-know to get research that we can put in newsletter form.  Any 
picture/graphic/article ideas are, of course, welcome.

FUTURE:
-Making banners for and set-up supplies for the next campaign meeting on the 
25th.  We need to make the place look more like a planning meeting.  We 
talked about making a big banner with our name on it, perhaps some posters.
-Make t-shirts and/or posters for either the campaign or to advertise the 
convention or the caravan.  Jess is looking into possible t-shirt places.
-Maintainance of the webpage will be done by Erric, Chris and Jess.  We will 
begin directly contacting people (esp. Chairs) to get info to put on the 
website.  It is important to keep this site interesting and dynamic--and 
also to get people actively involved in its content.
-We are going to be making a media strategy/plan so that we montior our 
visibility and make sure we are hitting a wide audience and getting our name 
out there as often as possible.
______________________________________________________





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:77
Sender:"Nicole Adler" <nicoleadler@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-10 00:06:45
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Re: logo and website
Message:

I think the logo with the people holding the banner is the best option out 
there right now.  I would love to see more options with hands or fists if 
anyone can think of any...  But a lot of these options are ALREADY out there 
from other organizations...but ultimately what we need is to gather as many 
potential logos as possible and vote on them on the 25th just as we voted on 
our official name.  Until then, we have to perhaps test the logos we have on 
people just as Zophia did.  I think we shouldn't get too caught up in the 
picture aspect of it.  We could always just have "People's Campaign" written 
in catchy lettering.  The key is that we want the symbol or lettering to be 
used on EVERYTHING and we want it to be recognizable as our campaign.  Would 
people feel better about just having stylized lettering rather than trying 
to come up with a graphic???  Let's just try to have this ironed out by or 
on the 25th!

-Nikki

Post ID:79
Sender:"Matthew Smith" <vivaohio@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-10 13:42:22
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Re: Fundraising meeting
Message:

Kris Bas- Since word has it that some ministers are getting on board, why 
not approach them about having an event in one of their halls...this might 
also ensure that the word gets out to the "flock". -Matt

>From: "kristina bas" <krisbas@...>
>Reply-To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>CC: jamkham@...
>Subject: [nbpeoplescampaign] Fundraising meeting
>Date: Thu, 09 Mar 2000 06:57:55 PST
>
>hello everyone,
>
>i volunteered to put together a summary of Sunday night's fundraising
>meeting so all can keep aware of our end of things:
>
>Attending: Kristina Bas, Frank Bright, Curtis Warren
>
>1- adhering to formal NJ Elec (Election Law Enforcement Commission)
>paperwork (ie. creation of PAC, reporting of funds, etc) is now underway.
>
>2- we have begun the first steps in creating campaign buttons/T-Shirts for
>sale, logos to be approved at next Steering committee meeting (which i
>believe they were)
>
>* NOTE: to all people's campaign activists: if you know of anyone or you
>yourself are a designer, artist, whatever, who'd like to create a design(s)
>for potential campaign T-Shirts, please let me know. I have some ideas 
>about
>designs but alas i'm not much for designing myself.
>
>in addition to using the official logo of the campaign (which i don't think
>has been decided on yet) i'd like to create some hip campaign wear for the
>youth and other groups that wouldn't otherwise purchase the normal 
>political
>tee (e.g. actually create t-shirts in size small and medium for smaller
>framed people)
>
>of course, all logos and designs, i imagine, will be approved by the
>Steering committee.
>
>3- we are investigating a potential Hip hop party fundraiser.
>
>4- we will be having a RAFFLE, for drawing on April 21st. further details 
>to
>be announced but keep in mind that we would like everyone to sell mountains
>and mountains of them....
>
>5- potential big money fundraising dinners, to be planned for the future...
>
>6- we are trying to get started a weekly people's campaign institution that
>will serve two functions: raising money and raising awareness. something
>small and low maintenance, but which begins to get the campaign into the
>minds of people in the community. Example: a weekly juice stand; weekly
>cheap vegetarian hot dinners; a weekly book sale via the campaign
>BookMOBILE; movie night, etc.
>
>please forward your ideas to me as well. remember, the trick is LOW
>MAINTENANCE, and HIGH VISIBILITY. this may sound impossible at first, but i
>have faith....
>
>IN addition, if anyone has any ideas in terms of big fundraising activities
>(E.G. a square dance, whatever!) please forward them to me. we want to
>organize events that address the diverse segments of new brunswick. So, if
>you know any hip hop artists (or other performers) personally who would be
>interested in performing, please let me know.
>Also, we are in DIRE need of potential VENUES. so if your uncle's sister's
>cousin owns an auditorium or tavern somewhere and would be happy to let us
>use it, please let me know.
>
>AND of course, we need people to participate in fundraising meetings. and
>i'm not talking about those of you who already attend 5.2 meetings per 
>week.
>new blood.... fundraising....new faces....fundraising...
>
>remember: it won't work without money (unfortunately!)
>
>peace,
>
>Kristina
>
>
>______________________________________________________
>

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:81
Sender:Keith Joseph <lknesta@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-10 19:45:00
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] letter on Pimp cops
Message:

This is a rough draft of a letter to the Home News

Dear Editor,

     The defense attorney's of New Brunswick police officers Marshall
and Chinchilla called the evidence against the officers "absurd" (Home
News Tribune 03/08/00) and asked that the charges be dismissed.  Were
the defense attorney's  emboldened to make this claim because State
Superior Court Judge Barnett Hoffman stated repeatedly that he "likes"
officer Marshall and that the two are friends? Hoffman arrogantly
reprimand the prosecutors for "building up a case".  The only thing
that  Judge Hoffman should dismiss is himself from the case because of
the conflict of interest. Hoffman's actions demonstrate the need for all
judges to be democratically elected.
    The defense and the police department as a whole have taken to
attacking the prosecution whiteness Corey Ashford who has provided tape
recorded evidence.  This evidence should be made public.  Ashford's
"record" has nothing to do with the guilt of these officers.
     The Home News Tribune has followed the lead of the court in using
the euphemism "official misconduct" to describe the shooting of  Officer
Marshall by Officer Chinchilla.  It is often described as a "phony
shooting".  The only problem is that there was nothing phony about it.
The officer shot at least 7  times in a residential neighborhood where
children play.  After one cop shot another cop, a police state emerged
in that neighborhood.  The officers described a suspect and though no
suspect existed many young black men were arrested for "questioning".
The evidence that these officers shot one another is more than
substantial. The report of the grand jury that cleared Officer Consalvo
of wrong doing in the murder of Sissy Adams, is filled with testimony of
relationships between New Brunswick police and New Brunswick
prostitutes.
     This case points to the crying need for an independent all elected,
all-civilian police review board with subpoena power.  Only a
independent body elected by the people with legal power can conduct a
serious investigation.  Finally this case testifies to the moral and
political bankruptcy of  New Brunswick's elected officials all of whom
have yet to say a word about this case.

Keith Joseph
New Jersey Freedom Organization
New Brunswick
732-545-7207





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:82
Sender:jml@... (Jml)
Post Date/Time:2000-03-12 01:03:01
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Re: logo and website
Message:

-> Guys, hate me but Im putting this out here.  I think it is great that we
-> have people on board designing our logo. This is a great gift. I feel
-> very strongly against using the top logo, the people stomping on fat
-> white cops and bureaucrats.  I think we would be cutting ourselves off
-> at the knees if we did.  If we cant use the bottom one because of DSA

Cutting ourselves off at the knees?  As if we are building this movement
with the help of the authoritarian administration we are trying to
overthrow?


-> With this logo, we are going to get those that are politicized, those
-> that are already communist.  But if our real goal is to reach a broader
-> audience of people who arent politically active right now, regular
-> folks, they'll probably be turned off.  If we are serious about building
-> political power, we need to reach people we havent yet reached by the
-> left.  This kind of imagery doesnt sell.

The goal of this campaign (and the logo for that matter) is not to make
people communist.  In fact, I didn't gather anything from the logo that
would indicate communism, and I would be against introducing communism
or communist ideology into this.


I saw the image and interpretted it as symbolizing teamwork and
overcoming the obstacles of the administration we face.  It has nothing
to do with individuals, other than the individuals we are trying to
replace in office.

I would not be against considering other logos, but I don't particularly
sympathize with your criticisms of this one.  It actually seems pretty
docile to me.   

Jim

Post ID:83
Sender:CHRIS KOZLOWSKI <CKOZLOWSKI@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-12 23:04:06
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] ATTENTION COMMITTEES : web site.
Message:

The web site is coming along nicely.  We are still waiting from each
committee for content pertaining to their role in the campaign.  Please look
at the site and make any comments.  One of the recent additions is a
submission form for flyers to the Media Committee.  Click on "Committees",
then "Media", then "Request a Flyer" to see what this will look like in the
future.  

The discussion forum is also operational.  Check it out and leave any
feedback.  CONTENT AND EEDBACK ARE ABSOLUTELY CRITICAL TO THE HEALTHY
EVOLUTION OF OUR WEB SITE.  I cannot stress this enough.

Chris Kozlowski

Post ID:86
Sender:"Barbara Horne" <aunatural@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-13 07:14:57
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Fwd: Documentary Screening
Message:


<HR>
<!doctype html public "-//w3c//dtd html 4.0
transitional//en">
<html>

<blockquote TYPE=CITE> </blockquote>
A message from <a
href="mailto:realized@...">Frank Sosa</a>
<blockquote TYPE=CITE>Hello all.  I've been
working hard on producing
this documentary on <b>Mumia Abu Jamal</b> for the
past year and would
greatly appreciate your attendance...It's a screening
party for the trailer
/ fundraiser (we're still trying to raise money to
finish it):
<p>  You are invited to a preview screening of
<p>  <b>VOICE OF THE VOICELESS</b>
<br>  <i>The Life. The words. The movement.</i>
<p>  6-9:00pm
<br>  Wednesday 3/15/2000
<br>  A documentary film in the making
<br>  directed by Tania Cuevas-Martinez
<br>  produced by Tatiana Litvin
<p>  Bar 13 (Los Angeles)
<br>  35 E. 13th street
<br>  (corner of University and 13th St.)
<br>  w/ DJ Daai Lo and friends
<p>  Donate $5 or more seeds and watch us grow
<p>  This project started as a compilation album
of which a portion
of the proceeds are going to benefit Mumia Abu-Jamal's
defense fund (who
I'm sure all of you know has been in prison for 18
years for a crime most
international human rights committees have agreed that
he did not commit).
The first single, entitled "Mumia 911" featured Afu
Ra,  SlimKid Tre
(Pharcyde), Wise Intelligent (Poor Righteous Teachers)
Aceyalone, p.e.a.c.e.
(Freestyle Fellowship), Zach de la Rocha (Rage Against
The Machine), Divine
Styler, Channel Live, Tragedy, Goldi Locks (Mumia's
daughter), The Last
Emperor, Black Thought (The Roots), Dead Pres, Pharaoh
Monch (Organized
Konfusion) and Chuck D (Public Enemy) and was produced
by Diamond D.
<p>  A camera crew was brought in during the time
of recording to
film interviews with all of the artists who
participated, conducted by
Bonz Malone.  The film is very powerful. 
Bonz takes each MC
off guard when he asks each one of them if they are
ready to die for the
cause.  Their reactions vary greatly and offer
incredible insight
into the world of hip-hop activism and the realization
of the power such
a movement can wield. In addition to this, the film
will have a broader
purpose which is to examine the state of the
revolution.
<p>  This film is different than other
documentary's we have seen
on Mumia.  We are able to show the personal side
of Mumia, as a man,
rather than as a criminal or martyr.  We shot
footage of his mother
and daughter at his home in Philadelphia, personal
stories are told and
family photos are shown.  We get an incredible
sense of who Mumia
really is, how his strong social conscience led him to
do the work he did,
We also see how contrary all of that is to any
depiction of him being a
murderer.
<p>  The documentary, Voice of the Voiceless, as
of now has no distribution. 
(Although I work at Interscope, the label has no
involvement with this
project).
<p>  This screening is for potential investors
but even if you are
not interested in investing, I would appreciate you
checking it out and
letting me know what you think.
<p>  Thanks.
<p>  -Tat
<p>

Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Re: letter on Pimp cops
Message:

Keith, Did you send this one out? There are a couple of minor grammatical 
errors. I think this letter is slammin--but I have one question: you write:

>substantial. The report of the grand jury that cleared Officer Consalvo
>of wrong doing in the murder of Sissy Adams, is filled with testimony of
>relationships between New Brunswick police and New Brunswick
>prostitutes." The second sentence doesn't seem to be continuous with the 
>first. Again, I think your letter is awesome, and we need to get out more 
>of these lines about elected judges and opening of testimony (at least some 
>of it) from the grand jury, especially when public officials are actually 
>indicted. Nice job, man. Paul


>From: Keith Joseph <lknesta@...>

Hi there,

There will be a fundraising dinner for the People's campaign on Saturday 
evening at 5:00 pm at 218 George Street, New Brunswick (F. Bright's house). 
This will be a rather low-key affair, but we invite all to come. The charge 
will be a $3 minimum (more if you have it) for a vegetarian pasta dinner. 
This will take place after the canvassing on Saturday afternoon, so it will 
be a great opportunity to relax, debrief, socialize, and prepare for the 
ARTHouse 559 event in the evening. For more information, contact Frank at 
249-7201.

Volunteers to prepare food, etc. would be great. Please contact me.

ADDITIONALLY:

The need is great for people to participate in the fundraising committee. If 
you know of any new people who are looking to get involved, please point 
them in our direction... Thanks!

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:92
Sender:"Zofia Nowakowski" <ZNowakowski@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-14 13:00:23
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Re: City Council meetings
Message:

Tomorrows City Council meeting will cover a bunch of different topics, including the following: 

- seemingly standard handicapped parking additions and deletions and changes in loading areas
- instituting charge for photocopying birth certificate/running open-ended searches on certificates
- approvals for street closings/festivals
- approval for redevelopment plan change on the tall building behind the County courthouse - since a developer is planning to redevelop it into office space and apartments, the City is imposing a parking requirement and a "building envelope" requirement - they want the outside to be redone so it matches the current style they are promoting instead of the old modernism.   (City planning board recommended this, was concerned about 'spot zoning' and parking density)
- approval to move the sites of a few Henry Oliver affordable housing units to another nearby area for the development because someone bought one of the plots/renovated and so the price of properties went up. 
-RCA agreement (regional contribution agreement) with Bethlehem I think for up to 9 affordable housing units.  Because of the Mount Laurel Court decisions of the 1970s and 1980s, in NJ currently each municipality must plan for a certain amount of affordable housing to be built within the municipality.  However, they can get around a portion of their obligation by giving the monies ($20,000 per unit in this case) to urban centers toward build the required affordable housing units.  On the one hand, it gets affordable housing builit in a time when Congress has completely cut back their funding for HUD.  On the other hand, it ends up maintaining the class segregation, and the system remains since central cities benefit from the RCA provision - one of the dwindling ways to get monies to support subsidized housing.  So its good that NB is getting these monies, but the larger picture is morbid.

I was going to flyer for this this time around, I dont know if it is worth it since there is nothing too big happening I think.

Ill send the future posted dates to all tomorrow, we should put them up on the website too.

The planning board will be meeting for site plan approval of Monument Square Block proposal April 12, without any delays.  We are currently investigating the details of this 15 story building with 200 luxury apartments, 200 hotel rooms, a convention center and training facility that will go in on Livingston and George.  We should see what we can get out of this for the community - cheap or free leasing space in the Convention Center to make it publicly accessible seems a minimum, although I dont know yet how we can have this happen,  since we have no catch - it does not require any variances unfortunately.  However the businesses will be displaced and it will dramatically shift traffic flows so there might be some catch there.  You should know the thing will be hideous.  High inhuman modernism, worse than the Bloustein builidng.  The current bankrupted hotel there is only 10 or so stories high.

Zofia Nowakowski
Fiscal Policy Institute
218 W 40th St, 3rd Fl
New York, NY 10018
Tel: 212.278.0878
Fax:212.730.1405





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:93
Sender:"paul mcgee" <shorepaulie@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-14 13:30:56
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] banners for motorcade on April 1
Message:

Hi all, I spoke with our artist friend Jabari about banners designs for the 
motorcade. I wanted to put out the ideas we came up with b4 we moved to make 
the banners. We're doing that at my house, 559 Hamilton St. Somerset 
729-0873. That'll be on Friday night, the 17th at 7pm. Please come and help. 
We need people with a steady hand and people who want to take part in an 
assembly line making placards and signs.

The first banner we discussed would feature a bunch of figures holding up a 
bunch of buildings made to look like a skyline, with city hall- and office- 
and housing- looking buildings. There would be a slogan on top and "New 
Brunswick People's Campaign" on the bottom.

The other would advertise the convention, with a huge "May 13" on one side 
and faces that looked like those on the other banner on the other side. 
Below the faces it would say "Your City Council" "Your Platform" "Your 
People's Convention". Across the top would read "New Brunswick People's 
Campaign".

Let me know what you think. And come over on Saturday night too, for 
Arthouse559. Poetry, Music, Singing Spoken Word Jam celebrating progressive 
and revolutionary culture and forging new relationships. $5 at the door to 
benefit the People's Campaign. Bring a book for Jersey Youth Correctional 
Facility's Prison Library and pay $4.

Paul   729-0873 or leave a msg on NJFO hotline. 545 5756.
______________________________________________________

not a cheap dinner....speaking from the experience of many bad fundraising 
events.  Paul

>From: "kristina bas" <krisbas@...>
>Reply-To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>To: njfo@egroups.com, nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com, jamkham@...
>Subject: [nbpeoplescampaign] Fundraising dinner!
>Date: Tue, 14 Mar 2000 09:19:02 PST
>
>Hi there,
>
>There will be a fundraising dinner for the People's campaign on Saturday
>evening at 5:00 pm at 218 George Street, New Brunswick (F. Bright's house).
>This will be a rather low-key affair, but we invite all to come. The charge
>will be a $3 minimum (more if you have it) for a vegetarian pasta dinner.
>This will take place after the canvassing on Saturday afternoon, so it will
>be a great opportunity to relax, debrief, socialize, and prepare for the
>ARTHouse 559 event in the evening. For more information, contact Frank at
>249-7201.
>
>Volunteers to prepare food, etc. would be great. Please contact me.
>
>ADDITIONALLY:
>
>The need is great for people to participate in the fundraising committee. 
>If
>you know of any new people who are looking to get involved, please point
>them in our direction... Thanks!
>
>Kristina
>249-9664

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:95
Sender:"Zofia Nowakowski" <ZNowakowski@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-14 14:03:25
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Addendum
Message:

One final point for the Council - the planning board recommended a change in the zoning ordinance that will make it more difficult for those adding bedrooms their buildings in certain residential zones to do so via a 1 1/2 per-bedroom parking space requirement as compared to prior 1 per bedroom requirement. 

Zofia Nowakowski
Fiscal Policy Institute
218 W 40th St, 3rd Fl
New York, NY 10018
Tel: 212.278.0878
Fax:212.730.1405





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:96
Sender:"paul mcgee" <shorepaulie@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-14 14:37:04
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Re: City Council meetings
Message:

Zofia, Thanks for the great detailed update. That's good info. Is it true 
that when the site plan goes through, the development is out of the public's 
hands legally?  Also, with those RCAs, there was an article published 
recently in the HNT stating that significant RCA monies, $1mm I think, will 
be put towards DEMOLITION of buildings in NB Homes, to supplement HOPE VI. 
Is this common practice? Can Mount Laurel be twisted any more? Paul

>From: "Zofia Nowakowski" <ZNowakowski@...>
>Reply-To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>Subject: [nbpeoplescampaign] Re: City Council meetings
>Date: Tue, 14 Mar 2000 13:00:23 -0500
>
>Tomorrows City Council meeting will cover a bunch of different topics, 
>including the following:
>
>- seemingly standard handicapped parking additions and deletions and 
>changes in loading areas
>- instituting charge for photocopying birth certificate/running open-ended 
>searches on certificates
>- approvals for street closings/festivals
>- approval for redevelopment plan change on the tall building behind the 
>County courthouse - since a developer is planning to redevelop it into 
>office space and apartments, the City is imposing a parking requirement and 
>a "building envelope" requirement - they want the outside to be redone so 
>it matches the current style they are promoting instead of the old 
>modernism.   (City planning board recommended this, was concerned about 
>'spot zoning' and parking density)
>- approval to move the sites of a few Henry Oliver affordable housing units 
>to another nearby area for the development because someone bought one of 
>the plots/renovated and so the price of properties went up.
>-RCA agreement (regional contribution agreement) with Bethlehem I think for 
>up to 9 affordable housing units.  Because of the Mount Laurel Court 
>decisions of the 1970s and 1980s, in NJ currently each municipality must 
>plan for a certain amount of affordable housing to be built within the 
>municipality.  However, they can get around a portion of their obligation 
>by giving the monies ($20,000 per unit in this case) to urban centers 
>toward build the required affordable housing units.  On the one hand, it 
>gets affordable housing builit in a time when Congress has completely cut 
>back their funding for HUD.  On the other hand, it ends up maintaining the 
>class segregation, and the system remains since central cities benefit from 
>the RCA provision - one of the dwindling ways to get monies to support 
>subsidized housing.  So its good that NB is getting these monies, but the 
>larger picture is morbid.
>
>I was going to flyer for this this time around, I dont know if it is worth 
>it since there is nothing too big happening I think.
>
>Ill send the future posted dates to all tomorrow, we should put them up on 
>the website too.
>
>The planning board will be meeting for site plan approval of Monument 
>Square Block proposal April 12, without any delays.  We are currently 
>investigating the details of this 15 story building with 200 luxury 
>apartments, 200 hotel rooms, a convention center and training facility that 
>will go in on Livingston and George.  We should see what we can get out of 
>this for the community - cheap or free leasing space in the Convention 
>Center to make it publicly accessible seems a minimum, although I dont know 
>yet how we can have this happen,  since we have no catch - it does not 
>require any variances unfortunately.  However the businesses will be 
>displaced and it will dramatically shift traffic flows so there might be 
>some catch there.  You should know the thing will be hideous.  High inhuman 
>modernism, worse than the Bloustein builidng.  The current bankrupted hotel 
>there is only 10 or so stories high.
>
>Zofia Nowakowski
>Fiscal Policy Institute
>218 W 40th St, 3rd Fl
>New York, NY 10018
>Tel: 212.278.0878
>Fax:212.730.1405
>
>

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:97
Sender:Brian Villa <villa@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-14 14:57:31
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Re: City Council meetings
Message:

The items in the agenda are standard. McGee's comments stand. Nota Bueno 
about the birth certificate search stuff: it is a pure revenue mechanism 
which has been going up and up for the last several years. Think of it 
as a cash cow barometer of the actual fiscal state of the city. Wait 
until the temporary budget ceases and the city actually has to have one 
certified by the State. Ten dollars versus one, you'll see a tax 
increase.

--BV





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:98
Sender:"Zofia Nowakowski" <ZNowakowski@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-14 14:46:13
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Re: City Council meetings
Message:

State Level Municipal Land Use Law sets the legal standard. - providing the boundaries of coverage of the local zoning ordinance, and supplementing it.  We still need to look into what we can do legally. Members of the planning board are very concerned about transportation issues - so while that may not be our paramount concern, that may be something we can emphasize.  Also, this building is receiving state funding, so we have the public interest argument on our side in negotiations that could take place outside of the formal approval process. 

Zofia Nowakowski
Fiscal Policy Institute
218 W 40th St, 3rd Fl
New York, NY 10018
Tel: 212.278.0878
Fax:212.730.1405





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:99
Sender:xavier.hansen@...
Post Date/Time:2000-03-15 09:32:34
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] No Subject
Message:

A message from the Steering Committee:

Congrats to all the folks who joined the canvass this 
past week-end. Spirits were high, we got a lot of 
surveys filled, and most important, we talked to a lot 
of people who want to join the campaign. WE STILL NEED 
TO SEE MORE NEW FACES! The Right to Know Committee sent 
the word that they are all coming to canvass this coming 
Saturday. How about the other committees? The City 
Machine will pour corporate money on the streets of New 
Brunswick like acid rain and we must match everyone of 
their dead dollars with the live energy of our 
volunteers committed to people's democracy. Let us all 
show we are up to the challenge. Sisters & brothers of 
the People's Campaign, come and talk to the PEOPLE!

UNITE, ORGANIZE, SEIZE POWER!

Xavier

Canvassers meet at the New Brunswick Public Library on 
Livingston Avenue, Saturday at 1PM and Sundays at 12 
Noon.





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:100
Sender:"paul mcgee" <shorepaulie@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-15 11:57:59
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Re: No Subject
Message:

Xavier put a slogan at the bottom of his message, "UNITE, ORGANIZE, SEIZE 
POWER!" So far, we don't have official slogans and logos and such. But on 
Friday we're going to make the banners and signs for the motorcade on the 
first of April. (Please come to 559 Hamilton St. right across from 
Krauszer's at 7p.m. to help.)

Yesterday I proposed that we put a logo featuring people holding up the 
image of a city onto one of the banners instead of the logo on the website 
and flyers. I spoke to Xavier about this and he pointed out that the already 
circulated logo has wide support and that it would be a mistake to place 
another logo onto banners, etc. I agreed with him and so I'm withdrawing the 
suggestion I made yesterday.

We're making two banners, so one more banner has to be made. I'm still 
suggesting we use that one to advertise the convention in May. I also think 
we should include the "Organize, Unite, Seize Power!" slogan on the second 
banner. Please tell me what you think, everybody. If people have specific 
ideas, please tell me or come on Friday. Anyone with artistic ability or who 
wants to do some fun work should come also. Thanks for feedback, Paul

PS-Come to 559 Hamilton Saturday night for Arthouse559 @ 8 p.m. Poetry music 
open mike spoken word, good company. $5 to benefit the people's campaign. $4 
with a book for prison library (no harlequins, please)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:101
Sender:"Zofia Nowakowski" <ZNowakowski@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-15 12:21:57
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Logo
Message:

Hi folks,

I would like again to ask that we not use the logo we have been using, and ask at least for a vote from all members.  I think it has a violent tone and we will scare people away.  I also think we should use Take Back the Power rather than "Seize" for the same reason.  I do not see this as different ideologically in what we plan to do - it is a matter of communicating to people.  I understand the "other side" has done violence via their policies and actions.  But I do not think we can build a campaign through a focus on retaliation.

Zofia

Zofia Nowakowski
Fiscal Policy Institute
218 W 40th St, 3rd Fl
New York, NY 10018
Tel: 212.278.0878
Fax:212.730.1405

have, that would help.  Otherwise, I'll be in NB Thursday-Sat & can run into

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:104
Sender:"Matthew Smith" <vivaohio@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-15 14:04:01
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Re: Logo
Message:

Some thoughts in response to Zofia's concerns about the campaign logo & use 
of term "seize":

I thought she was being overly cautious, as this is a time for the people's 
forces to be agressive, to strike while the iron's hot, if you will.  Too 
often forces on the left have been softened by elements that could be 
considered a "loyal opposition", who would be resistant to mounting a 
serious offensive targeting the imperialist achilles heel...democracy.  Of 
course we seek to draw a clear line of demarcation from such opportunism.

That said, Webster defines "SEIZE" as "to lay hold of or take by force" & 
"to attack or overwhelm physically".  Considering Malcolm X's ultimatum: The 
Ballot or the Bullet, the Peoples' Campaign is clearly-and wisely-taking the 
former path, as this is what current conditions warrant.  Therefor the 
question remains:  Are we seeking to "take by force" the NB City Hall?  Or 
does this position imply "The Bullet"?  Malcolm X also said that we must 
defend ourselves "by any means necessary."  What is necessary at this stage 
of the struggle is to continue mounting an United Front Offensive for 
People's Democracy.  In the literal sense, "seize" does not seem to reflect 
this stage.  Recall that in the War Against Iraq, the Imperialists first 
used "Desert Shield"  while negotiations were still underway.  It wasn't 
until the military offensive that "Desert Storm" was adopted.

The aim of the slogan should reflect the current state as well as the 
objectives of the movement. At this point it is to reach as broad a base as 
possible in order to insure a victory for the people come November.  It 
would be an error if the campaign slogan isolated possible allies by being 
"ahead" of where the movement is.  Therefore, unless the case can be made 
that  taking the struggle to the Ballot Box (Even into the streets) implies 
SEIZING power, I have to agree with Zofia...Take Back the Power seems 
appropriate enough. Or "Take the Power Back" would regester with anyone 
who's familliar with Tribe Called Quest and we would have a serious 
contender for an Official Campaign song!

Finally- RE: Logo concerns:  I think that the concept Paul wrote about for 
the banner is great:  A crowd or group of people holding up builings made to 
look like City Hall, Offices, Schools, Apartments, Etc. Kind of a "Whose 
City? Our City!" statement.  This could make a great logo.


>From: "Zofia Nowakowski" <ZNowakowski@...>
>Reply-To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>Subject: [nbpeoplescampaign] Logo
>Date: Wed, 15 Mar 2000 12:21:57 -0500

>through a focus on retaliation.

Message:

Well, if this is already been decided, so be it.  I still think that Zofia 
has had some valid points that at least could be flushed out in discusion.  
What does it mean to SEIZE POWER?  This level of struggle is a new 
experience for many of us, and it would be prudent to address such concerns 
as they arise.

(Unfortunately, I have to follow many of these developments as they 
transpire through this emial dialogue.  Living in Newark, I'm not in a 
position to keep up with the meetings.  So if my input seems superfluous, it 
would be helpful to know that too.)  Matthew.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:106
Sender:"paul mcgee" <shorepaulie@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-15 16:17:47
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Re: Logo
Message:

Matt, in your definition, you stated "to lay hold of or take by force". "OR" 
is the crucial point here. Aren't we trying to lay hold of more power? I 
think "Take the power back" implies we once had power. The majority has 
never had power. I vote to keep "Seize power". As far as banners go, I still 
say go with the one that's popular in the campaign. We'll finalize 
everything at the meeting, but time demands we make the banner ahead of the 
motorcade.  Paul

>From: "Matthew Smith" <vivaohio@...>
>Reply-To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>Subject: [nbpeoplescampaign] Re: Logo
>Date: Wed, 15 Mar 2000 11:04:01 PST
>
>Some thoughts in response to Zofia's concerns about the campaign logo & use
>of term "seize":
>
>I thought she was being overly cautious, as this is a time for the people's
>forces to be agressive, to strike while the iron's hot, if you will.  Too
>often forces on the left have been softened by elements that could be
>considered a "loyal opposition", who would be resistant to mounting a
>serious offensive targeting the imperialist achilles heel...democracy.  Of
>course we seek to draw a clear line of demarcation from such opportunism.
>
>That said, Webster defines "SEIZE" as "to lay hold of or take by force" &
>"to attack or overwhelm physically".  Considering Malcolm X's ultimatum: 
>The
>Ballot or the Bullet, the Peoples' Campaign is clearly-and wisely-taking 
>the
>former path, as this is what current conditions warrant.  Therefor the
>question remains:  Are we seeking to "take by force" the NB City Hall?  Or
>does this position imply "The Bullet"?  Malcolm X also said that we must
>defend ourselves "by any means necessary."  What is necessary at this stage
>of the struggle is to continue mounting an United Front Offensive for
>People's Democracy.  In the literal sense, "seize" does not seem to reflect
>this stage.  Recall that in the War Against Iraq, the Imperialists first
>used "Desert Shield"  while negotiations were still underway.  It wasn't
>until the military offensive that "Desert Storm" was adopted.
>
>The aim of the slogan should reflect the current state as well as the
>objectives of the movement. At this point it is to reach as broad a base as
>possible in order to insure a victory for the people come November.  It
>would be an error if the campaign slogan isolated possible allies by being
>"ahead" of where the movement is.  Therefore, unless the case can be made
>that  taking the struggle to the Ballot Box (Even into the streets) implies
>SEIZING power, I have to agree with Zofia...Take Back the Power seems
>appropriate enough. Or "Take the Power Back" would regester with anyone
>who's familliar with Tribe Called Quest and we would have a serious
>contender for an Official Campaign song!
>
>Finally- RE: Logo concerns:  I think that the concept Paul wrote about for
>the banner is great:  A crowd or group of people holding up builings made 
>to
>look like City Hall, Offices, Schools, Apartments, Etc. Kind of a "Whose
>City? Our City!" statement.  This could make a great logo.
>
>
>>From: "Zofia Nowakowski" <ZNowakowski@...>
>>Reply-To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>>To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>>Subject: [nbpeoplescampaign] Logo
>>Date: Wed, 15 Mar 2000 12:21:57 -0500
>>
>>Hi folks,
>>
>>I would like again to ask that we not use the logo we have been using, and
>>ask at least for a vote from all members.  I think it has a violent tone
>>and we will scare people away.  I also think we should use Take Back the
>>Power rather than "Seize" for the same reason.  I do not see this as
>>different ideologically in what we plan to do - it is a matter of
>>communicating to people.  I understand the "other side" has done violence
>>via their policies and actions.  But I do not think we can build a 
>>campaign
>>through a focus on retaliation.
>>
>>Zofia
>>
>>Zofia Nowakowski
>>Fiscal Policy Institute
>>218 W 40th St, 3rd Fl
>>New York, NY 10018
>>Tel: 212.278.0878
>>Fax:212.730.1405
>>

>To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>Subject: [nbpeoplescampaign] Re: LOGO/SLOGAN
>Date: Wed, 15 Mar 2000 11:11:51 PST
>
>Well, if this is already been decided, so be it.  I still think that Zofia
>has had some valid points that at least could be flushed out in discusion.
>What does it mean to SEIZE POWER?  This level of struggle is a new
>experience for many of us, and it would be prudent to address such concerns
>as they arise.
>
>(Unfortunately, I have to follow many of these developments as they
>transpire through this emial dialogue.  Living in Newark, I'm not in a
>position to keep up with the meetings.  So if my input seems superfluous, 
>it
>would be helpful to know that too.)  Matthew.

>>From: "paul mcgee" <shorepaulie@...>
>>Reply-To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>>To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>>Subject: [nbpeoplescampaign] Re: No Subject
>>Date: Wed, 15 Mar 2000 16:57:59 GMT
>>
>>Xavier put a slogan at the bottom of his message, "UNITE, ORGANIZE, SEIZE
>>POWER!" So far, we don't have official slogans and logos and such. But on
>>Friday we're going to make the banners and signs for the motorcade on the
>>first of April. (Please come to 559 Hamilton St. right across from
>>Krauszer's at 7p.m. to help.)
>>
>>Yesterday I proposed that we put a logo featuring people holding up the
>>image of a city onto one of the banners instead of the logo on the website
>>and flyers. I spoke to Xavier about this and he pointed out that the
>>already
>>circulated logo has wide support and that it would be a mistake to place
>>another logo onto banners, etc. I agreed with him and so I'm withdrawing
>>the
>>suggestion I made yesterday.
>>
>>We're making two banners, so one more banner has to be made. I'm still
>>suggesting we use that one to advertise the convention in May. I also 
>>think
>>we should include the "Organize, Unite, Seize Power!" slogan on the second
>>banner. Please tell me what you think, everybody. If people have specific
>>ideas, please tell me or come on Friday. Anyone with artistic ability or
>>who
>>wants to do some fun work should come also. Thanks for feedback, Paul
>>
>>PS-Come to 559 Hamilton Saturday night for Arthouse559 @ 8 p.m. Poetry
>>music
>>open mike spoken word, good company. $5 to benefit the people's campaign.
>>$4
>>with a book for prison library (no harlequins, please)
>>
>>>From: xavier.hansen@...
>>>Reply-To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com

>>>Subject: [nbpeoplescampaign] No Subject
>>>Date: Wed, 15 Mar 2000 14:32:34 +0000
>>>
>>>A message from the Steering Committee:
>>>
>>>Congrats to all the folks who joined the canvass this
>>>past week-end. Spirits were high, we got a lot of
>>>surveys filled, and most important, we talked to a lot
>>>of people who want to join the campaign. WE STILL NEED
>>>TO SEE MORE NEW FACES! The Right to Know Committee sent
>>>the word that they are all coming to canvass this coming
>>>Saturday. How about the other committees? The City
>>>Machine will pour corporate money on the streets of New
>>>Brunswick like acid rain and we must match everyone of
>>>their dead dollars with the live energy of our
>>>volunteers committed to people's democracy. Let us all
>>>show we are up to the challenge. Sisters & brothers of
>>>the People's Campaign, come and talk to the PEOPLE!
>>>
>>>UNITE, ORGANIZE, SEIZE POWER!
>>>

>>>Livingston Avenue, Saturday at 1PM and Sundays at 12
>>>Noon.

Post ID:109
Sender:Brian Villa <villa@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-15 18:41:11
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Re: Logo
Message:

Based on my understanding of the logo issue, I am for a vote and for 
"Take" as opposed to "Seize." If the traditional democratic party base 
is to be split, we have to be smart about it and not allow the other 
side to cause a "Seizure" in their coalition's voting bloc.

--BV





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:110
Sender:xavier.hansen@...
Post Date/Time:2000-03-15 22:28:26
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Logo & Slogan
Message:

Any permanent logo and slogan for the campaign should be 
voted on at a General Meeting or the Convention. 

In the meantime, one logo banner is being made for the 
first of many upcoming motorcades/public events. The 
media committee came up with a logo as they were asked 
to do and we should use them until we get to vote unless 
there is overwhelming opposition. So far the majority of 
both the Media and Outreach Committees support the logo. 
The logo should be replaced if a majority votes against 
it at the next general meeting. I support this logo 
because it honestly portrays that this campaign is a 
struggle between classes with opposing interests. The 
many people I spoke to during the canvass already know 
that J&J rules New Brunswick at their expense. Just 
about everyone of them said it to me very plainly. What 
they want to see before they join the campaign is that 
WE are not NAIVE and are prepared to struggle against 
the powers that be to win the elections. I think the 
logo is a step in that direction.

The slogan I used at the end of my last e-mail is NOT an 
official slogan of the campaign at this time. Actually 
Keith came up with it. He phrased it "Organize, Unite, 
Seize Power". Any slogan for the campaign should be 
voted on at the next meeting, etc. etc. I used this 
slogan in my e-mail for the same reason I support the 
logo. It is honest. Political power will NOT be simply 
handed over to the people of New Brunswick. The City 
Machine will not "play fair". In past campaigns, the 
machine used all forms of intimidation (cops with hands 
on holsters advancing menacingly on Afro-American would-
be voters), fraud (dead people voting many times) and 
harassment (one candidate for Mayor received bogus 
littering fines, another found all four of his tires 
flat on the morning of the elections) to keep an iron 
grip on power. The people KNOW THIS. They need to know 
that WE DO before they take the very real risk of openly 
defying the city machine. The cops so far haven't 
viciously brutalized or killed any Euro-American 
student, only Afro-Americans and Latinos...they are very 
aware of this, and so must we be. 

As a last point, I would advise all sisters and brothers 
in the campaign to be a little less concerned about 
alienating the middle class and a little more concerned 
about alienating the Afro-American and Latino workers 
and the students who make up the overwhelming majority 
of the city and who will NOT get involved in a half-
hearted attempt to take on a whole(stone cold, vampiric)
hearted enemy.

In unity,

Xavier.





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:111
Sender:"kristina bas" <krisbas@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-15 22:47:56
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Re: Logo
Message:

i'd be very happy to participate in an on-line vote regarding the logos. i 
thought they had to be approved by the steering committee before anything 
happened anyway? can i get some clarity on that?

well, in any case, can someone send the logos out as graphic images onto 
this discussion list, to refresh everyone's memory, including my own? it'd 
be much appreciated.

Zofia, i understand your concerns about the images and the word "sieze", 
though i disagree. however, i think this is an important discussion that 
should occur at the next campaign meeting and resolved through a democratic 
election.

Kristina

Post ID:112
Sender:"Matthew Smith" <vivaohio@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-15 23:09:49
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Re: Logo
Message:

Paul- Not to get too semantical
--Upon FURTHER further consideration, I ammend my position to that of 
support for "seizure" of power.  Xavier's recent piece provided needed 
clarity (Again, I am at the unfortunate disadvantage of not being directly 
involved in the process of campaign development) But essentially, I agree 
with X that we need to be clear and honest about who and what we are up 
against.  The Machine is not going to hand over the reigns of power so 
easily.  They have blood on their hands, and they have everything to loose 
while the people have everything to gain.  Seizing Power is what it is.  
They will put up a fight and we will have to be more cunning to wrestle it 
away.  Knowing this, we can conclude that we really must "Seize the 
Day!"...BY WHATEVER MEANS NECESSARY (Today the ballot box, tomorrow...)   I 
also concur with X that we must be less concerned with isolating the 
so-called middle-class and more concerned with allying ourselves with the 
working class who are ultimately going to be the driving force behind this 
campaign if its going to be successful.  As for the Logo, the current one 
needs work graphically if it's going to be used for a banner, but that can 
be arranged...See y'all Thursday at the Court Tavern 7pm or Paulie's 
Fri/Sat.  Matthew

>From: "paul mcgee" <shorepaulie@...>
>Reply-To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>Subject: [nbpeoplescampaign] Re: Logo
>Date: Wed, 15 Mar 2000 21:17:47 GMT
>
>Matt, in your definition, you stated "to lay hold of or take by force". 
>"OR"
>is the crucial point here. Aren't we trying to lay hold of more power? I
>think "Take the power back" implies we once had power. The majority has
>never had power. I vote to keep "Seize power". As far as banners go, I 
>still
>say go with the one that's popular in the campaign. We'll finalize
>everything at the meeting, but time demands we make the banner ahead of the
>motorcade.  Paul
>

Post ID:113
Sender:CHRIS KOZLOWSKI <CKOZLOWSKI@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-03-16 01:39:35
Subject:[nbpeoplescampaign] Re: Logo
Message:

Matt, I would like you to clarify what the distinction is between "middle
class" and "working class" in your perception.  Or do you identify the
middle class with capitalists?  If the working class does not include the
middle class, then we certainly are not talking about "the majority"
anymore.

Just a thought -- seems relevant to me.  I work, and I am middle class.  

Chris



-----Original Message-----
From: Matthew Smith
To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
Sent: 3/15/00 11:09 PM
Subject: [nbpeoplescampaign] Re: Logo

Paul- Not to get too semantical
--Upon FURTHER further consideration, I ammend my position to that of 
support for "seizure" of power.  Xavier's recent piece provided needed 
clarity (Again, I am at the unfortunate disadvantage of not being
directly 
involved in the process of campaign development) But essentially, I
agree 
with X that we need to be clear and honest about who and what we are up 
against.  The Machine is not going to hand over the reigns of power so 
easily.  They have blood on their hands, and they have everything to
loose 
while the people have everything to gain.  Seizing Power is what it is.

They will put up a fight and we will have to be more cunning to wrestle
it 
away.  Knowing this, we can conclude that we really must "Seize the 
Day!"...BY WHATEVER MEANS NECESSARY (Today the ballot box, tomorrow...)
I 
also concur with X that we must be less concerned with isolating the 
so-called middle-class and more concerned with allying ourselves with
the 
working class who are ultimately going to be the driving force behind
this 
campaign if its going to be successful.  As for the Logo, the current
one 
needs work graphically if it's going to be used for a banner, but that
can 
be arranged...See y'all Thursday at the Court Tavern 7pm or Paulie's 
Fri/Sat.  Matthew

>From: "paul mcgee" <shorepaulie@...>
>Reply-To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>Subject: [nbpeoplescampaign] Re: Logo
>Date: Wed, 15 Mar 2000 21:17:47 GMT
>
>Matt, in your definition, you stated "to lay hold of or take by force".

>"OR"
>is the crucial point here. Aren't we trying to lay hold of more power?
I
>think "Take the power back" implies we once had power. The majority has
>never had power. I vote to keep "Seize power". As far as banners go, I 
>still
>say go with the one that's popular in the campaign. We'll finalize
>everything at the meeting, but time demands we make the banner ahead of
the
>motorcade.  Paul
>
>>From: "Matthew Smith" <vivaohio@...>
>>Reply-To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>>To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>>Subject: [nbpeoplescampaign] Re: Logo
>>Date: Wed, 15 Mar 2000 11:04:01 PST
>>
>>Some thoughts in response to Zofia's concerns about the campaign logo
& 
>>use
>>of term "seize":
>>
>>I thought she was being overly cautious, as this is a time for the 
>>people's
>>forces to be agressive, to strike while the iron's hot, if you will.
Too
>>often forces on the left have been softened by elements that could be
>>considered a "loyal opposition", who would be resistant to mounting a
>>serious offensive targeting the imperialist achilles heel...democracy.
Of
>>course we seek to draw a clear line of demarcation from such
opportunism.
>>
>>That said, Webster defines "SEIZE" as "to lay hold of or take by
force" &
>>"to attack or overwhelm physically".  Considering Malcolm X's
ultimatum:
>>The
>>Ballot or the Bullet, the Peoples' Campaign is clearly-and
wisely-taking
>>the
>>former path, as this is what current conditions warrant.  Therefor the
>>question remains:  Are we seeking to "take by force" the NB City Hall?
Or
>>does this position imply "The Bullet"?  Malcolm X also said that we
must
>>defend ourselves "by any means necessary."  What is necessary at this 
>>stage
>>of the struggle is to continue mounting an United Front Offensive for
>>People's Democracy.  In the literal sense, "seize" does not seem to 
>>reflect
>>this stage.  Recall that in the War Against Iraq, the Imperialists
first
>>used "Desert Shield"  while negotiations were still underway.  It
wasn't
>>until the military offensive that "Desert Storm" was adopted.
>>
>>The aim of the slogan should reflect the current state as well as the
>>objectives of the movement. At this point it is to reach as broad a
base 
>>as
>>possible in order to insure a victory for the people come November.
It
>>would be an error if the campaign slogan isolated possible allies by
being
>>"ahead" of where the movement is.  Therefore, unless the case can be
made
>>that  taking the struggle to the Ballot Box (Even into the streets) 
>>implies
>>SEIZING power, I have to agree with Zofia...Take Back the Power seems
>>appropriate enough. Or "Take the Power Back" would regester with
anyone
>>who's familliar with Tribe Called Quest and we would have a serious
>>contender for an Official Campaign song!
>>
>>Finally- RE: Logo concerns:  I think that the concept Paul wrote about
for
>>the banner is great:  A crowd or group of people holding up builings
made
>>to
>>look like City Hall, Offices, Schools, Apartments, Etc. Kind of a
"Whose
>>City? Our City!" statement.  This could make a great logo.
>>
>>

>>>Subject: [nbpeoplescampaign] Logo
>>>Date: Wed, 15 Mar 2000 12:21:57 -0500
>>>
>>>Hi folks,
>>>
>>>I would like again to ask that we not use the logo we have been
using, 
>>>and
>>>ask at least for a vote from all members.  I think it has a violent
tone
>>>and we will scare people away.  I also think we should use Take Back
the
>>>Power rather than "Seize" for the same reason.  I do not see this as
>>>different ideologically in what we plan to do - it is a matter of
>>>communicating to people.  I understand the "other side" has done
violence
>>>via their policies and actions.  But I do not think we can build a
>>>campaign
>>>through a focus on retaliation.
