Post ID:307
Sender:"Zofia Nowakowski" <znowakowski@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-05-22 15:38:52
Subject:Planning Board
Message:

There will be a planning board meeting this Wednesday at 7:30 in CIty Hall.

Heldrich Plaza is up for approval. This is a 15 story building with luxury apts, hotel/convention center, private healthclub and pool, 300 car parking.  They will also be dealing with the Antioch Community Development Corp and an amendment to the zoning ordinance for R-5 districts (residential) regarding requiring adequate parking circulation.

It would be great to have people at this meeting to register concern about the development.  If someone has time to review the plans in the office that would be good too - generally approval is conditional upon meeting specific requirements of zoning - in this case, the downtown redevelopment district.  I can never get to the office so that is a problem.  IF we decide it is wise we may be able to tie up the project after the fact.  Anyway, I think the word is we dont want to wage a specific campaign around this now, as this would divert energies from the general campaign.

Let me know if you or anyone can get the downtown redevelopment plan fromthe office tomorrow and review the plans to determine accordance.  I already have the master plan and general zoning ordinance.

Thank you.

Zofia

Zofia Nowakowski
Fiscal Policy Institute
218 W 40th St, 3rd Fl
New York, NY 10018
Tel: 212.278.0878
Fax:212.730.1405





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:308
Sender:Villa@...
Post Date/Time:2000-05-23 11:32:49
Subject:FW: S26 Global Day of Action
Message:


--- Original Message ---
"Michael Dolan" <MDOLAN@...> Wrote on 
Tue, 23 May 2000 10:32:55 -0400
 ------------------ 
Our friends across the Atlantic have sent this out.  Sorry for
cross-postin=
g.  As you know, the IMF and World Bank will meet again in Prague
in =
September.  Contact info below.
______________________________________________________
Already, many groups around the world are preparing for this
event, in
recognition that the capitalist system, based on the exploitation
of
people, societies and the environment for the profit of a few,
is the
prime cause of our social and ecological troubles.

September 26-28 the IMF and World Bank are holding their 55th
annual
summit in Prague. A mass mobilisation of people to Prague is
beginning. On
September 26 peoples of the world will express their opposition
to the
World Bank and the IMF and their policies. Peoples of the world
will join
together in an expression of solidarity with the demonstrators
in Prague.

European grassroots groups have met recently and are planning
a European
wide mobilisation to Prague and also decentraslised action. The
idea has
been discussed and supported by several Latin American movements
which met
in Nicaragua recently. The Indian 'National Alliance of People's
Movements' issued a statement, just before the A16 protests in
Washington,
which you can read here. More messages from round the world are
on the
Calls to Action page.

The September 26 Global Day of Action proceeds from the successes
of the
previous global Days of Action against Capitalism on June 18
and November
30 of last year and May 1 of this year. S26 expands on these
previous Days
in the same spirit. Through those Days our networks grew, we
learned much,
and we saw many new people engage themselves. September 26 will
continue
this process of building up a strong, bold, and creative grassroots
movement for a society in which people do not exploit or oppress
each
other, communities or the environment, but one that is based
on
solidarity, co-operation, grassroots democracy, and ecological
sustainability.

As on previous occasions, people of different movements and different
countries will join forces on this day against the social, political,
and
economic institutions of the capitalist system - in particular
against the
World Bank and the IMF.

Workers, the unemployed, students, trade unionists, peasants,
the
landless, fishers, women groups, ethnic minorities, indigenous
peoples,
peace activists, environmental activists, ecologists, and so
on will work
in solidarity with one another in the understanding that their
various
struggles are not isolated from each other. The simultaneous
occupation
and transformation of the capitalist social order around the
globe - in
the streets, neighbourhoods, fields, factories, offices, commercial
centres, financial districts, and so on - will strengthen mutual
bonds at
the local, national, and international levels.

As before, the day will be organised in a non-hierarchical way,
as a
decentralised and informal network of grassroots groups that
employ
non-authoritarian, grassroots democratic forms of organisation,
struggle
independent of the social, political, and economic institutions
of the
capitalist system, and seek to effect change directly through
their own
action. Each event or action will be organised autonomously by
each group,
while coalitions of various movements and groups can be formed
at the
local, regional, and national levels. A strategy that may be
useful at the
local level is that various groups co-operate in creating a surrounding
atmosphere of carnival and festivity as a setting for their various
actions.

Examples of conceivable actions are: strikes - demonstrations
- critical
mass bike rides - carnivals - street parties - reclaiming streets,
government land or office buildings for non commercial and good
activities
- marches - music - dancing - speeches - handing out flyers -
banner
hangings - distributing community controlled newspapers - street
theatre -
building gardens - handing out free food - mock trade fairs -
offering no
interest loans outside major banks - solidarity actions - pickets
-
occupations of offices - blockades and shutdowns - appropriating
and
disposing of luxury consumer goods - sabotaging, wrecking, or
interfering
with capitalist infrastructure - appropriating capitalist wealth
and
returning it to the working people - declaring oneself independent
from
capitalism and authoritarian governments - setting up grassroots'
community councils and holding meetings outside city halls -
setting up
economic alternatives, like workers' co-operatives - promoting
economic
alternatives to capitalist companies - promoting grassroots based
forms of
community organisation - etc.

If you or your group plan to join this day of action, please
let others
know as soon as possible, to facilitate networking and communication.
There are several international mailing lists available for open
discussions and co-ordination (see resources).

A public international contacts list is regularly posted to them
in order
to facilitate decentralized and non-hierarchic networking. To
have your
contact information added to it, please contact resistance@...,
indicating (a) the country and location in which you plan to
take action,
plus any other information you see fit, for instance (b) the
name of your
group, coalition or yourself, (c) the events or actions being
planned, (d)
your land address, (e) email address, (f) telephone number, (g)
fax number
or (h) web site.

There are many things we need to do, to make the best of September
26 at
the global, local, and national levels. We need to spread information
about it among as many suitable groups and movements as possible.
We need
to spread and share propaganda materials, such as leaflets and
posters.
And, in general, we need to share our experiences, thoughts and
ideas with
one other and help each other out. At the local level, information
about
the day needs to be spread and discussed among groups and individuals,
meetings need to be organised, events planned, leaflets printed
and
distributed, funds raised, laughter and conversation shared.

The process of building up our movements can and should be continued
through further global days of action against capitalism in the
future.

Any "enquiries" or concerns about the September 26 global day
of action
should be directed to other activists in the group, city, country
or on
the various mailing lists, for us to mutually help each other
with ideas
and advise. There is no-one in charge or pulling the strings
for the day.
It will be a radically decentralised and non-hierarchic event
entirely of
our own creation in co-operation and solidarity with one another.

NEEDED: Translators !!! To make S26 information available in
every
language, especially Spanish, French, German, Russian, Arabic,
Dutch, and
Chinese.
 from http://212.67.202.59/~resistance/s26/=20
Please contact resistance@...=20

                       ********

Mike Dolan
Deputy Director, Public Citizen's Global Trade Watch
Field Director, Citizens' Trade Campaign
202-454-5122 (tel), 202-547-7392 (fax)
215 Pennsylvania Ave. SE
Washington, DC  20003
mdolan@...
www.tradewatch.org

The FREE way to access your mailbox via any web browser, anywhere!

>Labor Rally to Support the MoMA Strikers
>Thursday, May 25, 4-6 pm
>In front of the Museum, 11 West 53rd Street (between 5th & 6th Avenues)
>
>Curators, conservators, librarians, secretaries, visitor assistants,
>educators, writers and sales & marketing staff of the Museum of Modern
>Art, members of Local 2110/UAW, are now in their fourth week of a strike
>over poverty-level wages, health benefits cuts and the Museum's refusal
>to grant union rights to this mainly female union.

Post ID:310
Sender:Villa@...
Post Date/Time:2000-05-24 08:31:07
Subject:Jeb and George Bush to the Death! -- A Message from Michael Moore
Message:


--- Original Message ---
        TVNatFans@... Wrote on 
        Tue, 23 May 2000 11:01:43 EDT
 ------------------ 
Jeb and George Bush to the Death! Tomorrow
Night (Wed.) on "The Awful Truth"

May 23, 2000

Dear Friends,

Yesterday, the Los Angeles Times, in
reviewing an advance screening of tomorrow
night's episode, called "The Awful Truth" the
"smartest, funniest, most subversive satire on
TV."

Tomorrow night (Wednesday, May 24), if you
tune in to our show, "The Awful Truth," on
Bravo, here is what you'll see:

-- The "African American Wallet Exchange
Program," wherein I take a trip to Harlem to
distribute Day-Glo Orange wallets so that the
police will no longer mistake a black man's
wallet for a gun. Last year, the police fired 41
bullets and killed a man named Amadou
Diallo -- whose only crime was that he was
holding his wallet. This is one of many such
incidents around the country where unarmed
black citizens have been killed because the
cops thought they "saw something."

-- The Sibling Rivalry of the Century! Gov. Jeb
Bush vs. Gov. George W. Bush in a race to the
death! Death PENALTY, that is. On tomorrow
night's show, we send our cheering section to
"support" the Bush brothers as they each try
to outdo each other in executing more
prisoners. We've got marching bands,
cheerleaders, big scoreboards, and lots of
fans who show up at actual executions in
Texas and Florida to root-root-root for the
home team! If this all seems a little dark and
twisted, well, that's why we're on at 10pm!

-- Throughout the show tomorrow, it's
"Compassionate Conservative Night," where
we'll have actual Wall Street bankers and
investors, most of whom are worth millions,
participating in a number of REAL events, such
as "Dunk the Homeless," "Pie the Poor," and
"Pin the Tail on the Illegal Alien." Did I say
the Death Penalty piece was out there? Whoa,
wait 'til you see this!

The NRA held their convention over the
weekend and a bunch of gun-nuts have
started a letter writing campaign against the
show! Thank you, Moses! Ol' Charlton Heston
holding up that rifle and screaming his head
off on Saturday was priceless. But their
announcement that they were going to invade
Times Square and open up a theme store and
restaurant -- well, thems fightin' words! Trust
me, they will rue the day they invade our set!
Pistol Pete will not be packing!

So, don't forget to tune in this Wednesday
night (tomorrow), on Bravo, at the following
times:
   10pm and 1am        Eastern
   9pm and Midnight    Central
   8pm and 11pm        Mountain
   7pm and 10pm        Pacific

(And in the U.K., we're on tonight -- Tues. --
in the 11pm hour on Channel 4)

Thanks again, and let me know what you
think.

Go Lethal Injection!

Go Electric Chair!

Go you Bloody Bushes!!

Yours, Michael Moore
http://www.michaelmoore.com
http://www.theawfultruth.com
mmflint@...

P.S. Check out Ben Hamper's latest rant
(http://www.michaelmoore.com/hamper/nyc.html)
-- an account, of sorts, covering his recent trip
to New York to work on "The Awful Truth."


-----
Sent using MailStart.com ( http://MailStart.Com/welcome.html )
The FREE way to access your mailbox via any web browser, anywhere!

In attendance:
Mike, Jeremy, Matt, Jess, Chris, Keith, Jim

Mike completed most of the General Pamphlet.  We
are waiting on bios from the candidates, and then it
will hit the streets.

Jeremy completed a Spanish translation of the General
Flyer.  It will be available on the web Thursday.

Matt and Jess did a Board of Ed Campaign flyer.  It
will be available on the web Thursday.

Keith wrote a letter to New Brunswick businesses for 
donations and advertisements in the newspaper.

Chris will complete a press release by Friday morning.
It will be faxed by Jim and Daryle over the weekend.

Jim will complete an article on the Convention by next
Wednesday.  

The platform is now available on the web.  Jess and 
Mike will make changes to the web format over the next

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:313
Sender:xavier.hansen@...
Post Date/Time:2000-05-31 01:18:22
Subject:FROM THE STEERING COMMITTEE
Message:

The following resolution was approved 6-0 at the 
Steering Committee meeting of 5/29/2000. In attendance 
were Danny Rosado, Janice Payce, Keith Joseph, Audrey 
Allred, Frank Bright & Xavier Hansen. Joe Smith was also 
present but he left the meeting before the vote was 
taken.

************

Our historic first People�s Convention of New Brunswick 
brought together representatives from all communities 
and classes willing to struggle for democracy. We 
unanimously adopted our program and elected three 
candidates with clear majorities who will run in the 
elections to the City Council on November 7. This great 
success has given new energy to the People�s Campaign. 
We have already more than 60 active volunteers and we 
are growing every day. United, we can win.
Unfortunately, four individuals in the People�s 
Campaign, from the group Block on Lock, are currently 
distributing a letter that viciously attacks one of our 
candidates, Curtis Warren Sr. This letter slanders 
Curtis by claiming that he fails to support the People�s 
Campaign program and wants to cut a deal with the City 
Machine. Block on Lock bases this ridiculous insult on a 
single article in the Home News Tribune in which a 
reporter quoted Curtis at the Convention saying he was 
not going "to tear down the political machine" and that 
he would work with pharmaceutical companies to "solve 
the city�s drug problem" (see Home News Tribune, Sunday 
May 14, Local Section). 
The Home News Tribune is a big business newspaper tied 
to the corrupt New Brunswick City Machine No one in 
their right mind should expect them to report truthfully 
on the People�s Campaign. This is why we print our own 
newspaper to make sure we bring the real campaign news 
to the people. And this why we must prepare our 
candidates to make short and clear statements promoting 
the program of the People�s Campaign when dealing with 
other reporters. Because we had so much work to get 
ready for the convention, we did not prepare our 
candidates to deal with the press that day. Curtis spoke 
to the reporter for over ten minutes about the People�s 
Campaign. The Home News Tribune editors printed only two 
sentences to represent their views, not ours. 
Block on Lock never called Curtis to raise their 
concerns about his quotes. They never considered the 
four years Curtis has dedicated in the struggle against 
police brutality in New Brunswick and the many public 
speeches he has made to promote the struggle for 
democracy and to oppose the corrupt City Machine. And 
they never considered the respect Curtis has earned in 
all of New Brunswick�s communities for his courage and 
integrity, which is why he received the most votes of 
any candidates at the People�s Convention. The letter 
Block on Lock is distributing is really an attempt to 
demoralize and disrupt the campaign at a time when 
everyone is working their hardest to gather hundreds of 
petition signatures in only two weeks to put our 
candidates on the ballot. It is an attempt to sabotage 
the campaign by trying to weaken us and to strengthen 
our opponents.
The People�s Campaign is based on a broad unity around 
our program and our candidates, democratically voted on 
at the People�s Convention. Everyone has the right 
distribute their own flyers as long as they do not go 
against the unity of the People�s Campaign. Anyone who 
wants to attack the People�s Campaign by insulting and 
slandering one of our candidates must do so from outside 
the campaign. I propose to the Steering Committee that 
all those who signed the Block on Lock letter be 
immediately suspended from all campaign activities. They 
should not be allowed back into the campaign unless they 
renounce their letter openly. This is not an easy 
decision for us to make since we work so hard to keep 
everyone united in the campaign. But we cannot let down 
the people of New Brunswick and allow the whole campaign 
to be divided and defeated because we are afraid to make 
hard choices. And we cannot win our struggle for 
democracy if we allow anyone to stab us in the back when 
we must all stand shoulder to shoulder on the front line.

Xavier Hansen
Campaign Manager
5/29/2000

***************************************

The Steering Committee suspended Cliff Smith, Joe Smith 
and Jayson Hawkins from all campaign activities. They 
may return to the campaign should they decide to 
renounce their slanderous letter in writing. 

Keith Joseph is writing a response to the Block on Lock 
letter on behalf of the People's Campaign. Copies of 
both letters will be available at the next General 
Meeting on June 17.





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:314
Sender:xavier.hansen@...
Post Date/Time:2000-05-31 01:32:09
Subject:WOMEN & YOUTH CAUCUSES
Message:

Two proposals to form additional caucuses were brought 
to the Steering Committee meeting of 5/29/2000.

Nikki Engel proposes the formation of a Women's Caucus 
in the People's Campaign. The Steering Committee 
supports this proposal and recommends that the caucus be 
organized at the next General Meeting on June 17.

Kevin proposes the formation of a Youth Caucus in the 
People's Campaign. The Steering Committee supports this 
proposal as well and recommends that Outreach Chair 
Samantha Prince assist all interested youth in forming 
this caucus.  

Janice Payce and Curtis Warren have also begun 
organizing to form a Black Caucus in the People's 
Campaign. And of course, a Latino Caucus (Comite Latino) 
was formed at the People's Convention and held its first 
preparatory meeting last week with 12 participants.

The Steering Committee, by a vote of 6-0, passed the 
following guidelines for the caucuses in order to assure 
fair representation to all in the People's Campaign:

Any caucus that recruits 10 or more active organizers to 
its meetings may elect a representative to the Steering 
Committee.

In unity, 

Xavier Hansen
Campaign Manager

**********




         NEW BRUNSWICK: NBT event to focus on residents'
         quality of life 

         Published in the Home News Tribune 5/31/00 

         STAFF REPORT

         An overview of New Brunswick Tomorrow's plans for improving the
quality of
         life for the people of New Brunswick will be discussed by
Stephen O'Connor,
         president of NBT, at 12:15 p.m. June 7 at the New Brunswick
Public Library, 60
         Livingston Ave.

         The event is sponsored by the Friends of the library as its
final First Wednesday
         program of the current season.

         O'Connor will discuss in depth NBT's mission to provide social
and human
         services initiatives in the city. 

         O'Connor, a community development specialist, has been NBT
president nearly
         five years. Before coming to New Brunswick, he was executive
director of the
         New Jersey Housing Assistance Corp. and was a vice president of
the Matrix
         Development Group, which is now playing a major role in New
Brunswick's
         downtown commercial, retail and residential renewal.

         A graduate of Rutgers University, he has a master's degree from
Harvard
         University and is a candidate for a Ph.D. at Rutgers. 

         Active in many community service organizations, he received the
coveted
         Franklin Delano Roosevelt Award from the New Jersey Chapter of
the March of
         Dimes and served on the Board of Operation Smile, which
provides free
         reconstructive plastic surgery for children around the world
born with severe
         facial deformities. 

         The event is free and open to the public.

         from the Home News Tribune 

         Published: May 31, 2000





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:316
Sender:b v <villavoice@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-05-31 13:31:58
Subject:School Ethics Commission Decision re Arocho of N.B. Board of Education
Message:

My complaint against New Brunswick Board of Education
member Martin Arocho has been substantiated. He has
been found to have broken state ethics law known as
the School Ethics Act. In its May 23rd meeting the New
Jersey School Ethics Commission found his employment
with the Puerto Rican Action Board and his vote to
award that organization a $415,000 contract a
violation of Section 24(c). The Commission's
recommendation of censure as a penalty will be
reviewed by the state Education Commissioner. After
this, this matter may be concluded. If not, the case
is then appealed to the State Board of Education.

The case will be available for viewing at the state
Department of Education's website under the School
Ethics Commission link. You will need Adobe Acrobat to
view the document.

For those who have helped and offered encouragement,
thank you, thank you!

La lucha continua...

--Brian Villa

Subject:Fundraising Dinner

Hello all,

The fundraising committee is planning a dinner for July 14th.  The cost
will be $100 per plate.  We intend to send invitiations out in letter
form to people around the state.  We need EVERYONE to compile a list of
people to invite.  Some suggestions: professors, attorneys, leaders of
community organizations (religious, political, service), small business
owners, or anyone else who may be interested and able to pay $100 a
plate.  Please think about this and send any and all names (and contact
info if you have it) to Kristina at krisbas@... by Monday, June
5, so we can have a working list by next Wednesday's meeting.  We would
like to keep track of who refers who, but if you would like it to be
confidential (so they don't know you gave us their name) please let us
know.
Thanks,
Julie

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:318
Sender:Villa@...
Post Date/Time:2000-06-01 09:35:33
Subject:School Board/Ethics Complaint Newspaper Articles
Message:

Here are the articles. I especially urge the members of the media
committee to study the differences in the articles and ask me
about the dynamics of the two newspapers and why "objective news"
has two distinctly different articles, and how this will impact
upcoming political efforts.

--BV

FROM THE 6/1/00 STAR_LEDGER:

School official faces censure 

                By Alexander Lane
                STAFF WRITER

                The state School Ethics Commission has recommended
that New Brunswick school board President Martin Arocho be formally
censured for crossing an ethical line. 

                Arocho should have abstained from a 1998 board
vote to award a $415,583 contract for preschool services to the
nonprofit Puerto Rican Action Board, for which Arocho works,
the commission ruled. 

                Arocho's employment at Puerto Rican Action Board
"might reasonably be expected to impair his objectivity," the
decision read. 

                Commissioner of Education David Hespe will now
decide whether to formally censure Arocho. Generally, the commissioner
follows the ethics commission's
suggestions. 

                Brian Villa, the activist who filed the complaint
against Arocho, called the decision a victory. 

                "The complaint was substantiated and he was found
to have violated the law, that's the bottom line," Villa said.
"This is also a message that thoughtful committed citizens can
impose moral and ethical standards on board members who often
flout the public's wishes." 

                Arocho was not reachable, but Superintendent
of Schools Ronald Larkin lauded the decision. 

                "I'm very happy with the censure, it basically
validates that there was no wrongdoing," Larkin said. "They had
to give him something and that was the least severe." 

                Larkin pointed out that the contract would have
passed easily had Arocho abstained, and Arocho's voting was just
an oversight. "It wasn't done with any favor or anything of that
nature," Larkin said. 

                Villa has long said the school board should be
democratically elected rather than appointed by the mayor. He
has a reputation for keeping a close eye on the board -- but
this is his first successful ethics complaint. 

                "I touched the Blarney stone and they said that
I would never do it," Villa said. "I won on the merits." 


FROM THE 6/1/00 HOME NEWS TRIBUNE:

NEW BRUNSWICK: State panel rules school board head broke law


VOTE INVOLVED EMPLOYER 

By JAKE STUIVER

           New Brunswick board of education President Martin
Arocho violated state law when he voted in favor of awarding
a contract to his employer, the Puerto Rican Action Board, the
state School Ethics Commission has ruled.

           The commission, which operates under the state Department
of Education, found May 23 that Arocho violated the School Ethics
Act. The commission recommended a penalty of censure.

           Arocho could not be reached for comment yesterday
evening. He became president of the board earlier this year.

           New Brunswick activist Brian Villa filed a complaint
against Arocho and board member Edwin Guiterrez
last year for voting on a July 1998 resolution awarding a $415,583
contract to the nonprofit PRAB to provide preschool for city
4-year-olds.

           Villa said the two board members should have abstained
from the vote because they were both listed as
members of PRAB in a board flier and because Arocho worked for
PRAB. He also challenged Guiterrez's appointment to the board
by Mayor Jim Cahill because he is a city employee working in
the Community Development Division.

           The commission dismissed the complaints against Guiterrez,
finding that Guiterrez's employment with the city
does not constitute a substantial conflict and that Guiterrez
was not a member of PRAB at the time of the
vote in 1998. Guiterrez was a founding member of PRAB in 1971
and served on the group's board of trustees until 1991.

           The commission found that Arocho also was not a member
of PRAB at the time of the vote, but he was an
employee of the organization and therefore violated a statute
that prohibits school officials from acting on
any matter in which they or an immediate family member has a
direct financial involvement.

           At the time, Board Attorney George Hendricks said
that if he knew Arocho was a PRAB employee when the vote was
taken, he would have advised him to abstain. According to the
state document detailing the finding, Hendricks also argued the
board first contracted with PRAB in July 1993, prior to Arocho's
employment with the organization in 1997.

           Hendricks also argued Arocho had been hired by PRAB
under a state Department of Community Affairs grant in 1997,
and that his job had nothing to do with PRAB's preschool program,
according to the document.

           Villa said he's satisfied with the judgment.

           "A lot of unnecessary things were said about my claim,
and those things turned out to be false," he said.



-----
Sent using MailStart.com ( http://MailStart.Com/welcome.html )
The FREE way to access your mailbox via any web browser, anywhere!

Subject:Fwd: An Explosive Night of Hip Hop for Vieques in NYC - STOP THE BOMBS: U.S. NAVY OUT OF VIEQUES
Message:



>From: "Vieques Libre" <viequeslibre@...>
>To: List Member <vivaohio@...>
>Subject: An Explosive Night of Hip Hop for Vieques in NYC - STOP THE BOMBS: 
>U.S. NAVY OUT OF VIEQUES
>Date: 31 May 2000 23:21:13 -0000
>
>Vieques Libre - http://www.viequeslibre.org
>
>***** Please Post and Forward *****
>
>On Friday, June 9th, 2000 at the Martin Luther King, Jr. Labor Center 1199
>SEIU located at 410 West 43rd street (between 8th & 9th Avenue) in New
>York City beginning at 7pm, Todo Nueva York Con Vieques and Somos Arte
>present STOP THE BOMBS: U.S. NAVY OUT OF VIEQUES - an explosive night of
>hip hop bringing light to the human rights violations occuring in Vieques,
>Puerto Rico. The ticket price is $15 and ticket sales information is
>available at 212-631-4620.
>
>Among those scheduled to perform at this event are hip hop recording
>artists Fat Joe, Tony Touch, Non-Phixion, afro-funk band Antibalas and
>international performing artist, La Bruja.  Also performing are Hip Hop
>legends Rock Steady Crew and direct from Puerto Rico, Shanghai Assassinz.
>Coming soon, the "Stop the Bombs" complilation single featuring guest
>artists and surprise emcees. For more information on the event or the
>single, email somosarte@....
>
>Since 1938, the U.S. Navy has occupied two thirds of the island of
>Vieques, leaving its natives sandwiched in between bomb testings and other
>fight simulations. As a result, Vieques has an alarmingly high incidence
>of cancer among many other serious health problems.
>
>A portion of all proceeds from all "Stop the Bombs" projects will go to
>the movement to educate people of the human and civil rights violations
>occuring in Vieques, P.R. and to the Alianza de Mujeres Viequenses
>(Vieques Women's Alliance).
>
>Todo Nueva York con Vieques seeks to raise awareness about the human and
>civil rights violations taking place in Vieques as a result of the U.S.
>Navy's presence on the island municipality. Todo Nueva York con Vieques'
>work lies primarily in building coalitions among trade unions, elected
>officials, and community organizations in order to further, through
>advocacy and activism, the demands of the people of Vieques:
>demilitarization, devolution, development and decontamination. To contact
>Todo Nueva York con Vieques send e-mail to TNYVieques@....
>
>Somos Arte specializes in offering services in multimedia arts and all
>aspects of special event coordination. Led by two intellectual artists
>turned entrepeneurs, Somos Arte is Spanish for "We are art."
>
>More info on the event:
>http://www.geocities.com/stopthebombs2000/

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:323
Sender:Villa@...
Post Date/Time:2000-06-05 10:33:05
Subject:NEWS: Assistant City Attorney Accused of Stealing
Message:

This presents an opportunity to present efforts for good government,
accountability and open books at the next city council meeting.

Brian Villa
732-220-1405

**********
STAR-LEDGER
Lawyer accused of raiding account 

             06/01/00

             By Alexander Lane
             STAFF WRITER

             One of New Brunswick's part- time city
             prosecutors is facing state disciplinary action
for allegedly writing himself a $5,000 check from a
             client's escrow account to buy Christmas
             presents. 

             If the state Office of Attorney Ethics proves that
             charge against attorney Frank Shamy at a June
             15 hearing, it is likely Shamy will be disbarred,
             said Lee Gronikowski, deputy ethics counsel at
             the state agency. 

             ''If you do it, you go. There's not a lot of talk
about
             mitigation, extenuation, aggravation,"
             Gronikowski said. 

             The misappropriation charge is the most serious
             of three contained in an April 6 complaint
             Gronikowski lodged against Shamy after the
             agency did a random audit of financial records for
             Shamy's private law practice. 

             The agency -- an arm of the state Supreme Court
             -- also charged that Shamy misrepresented the
             status of a real estate transaction and committed
             record keeping violations. 

             In a written response to the complaint, Shamy
             said he borrowed the $5,000, but said he had his
             client's permission to do so. He denied
             intentionally lying about the real estate
             transaction, and said he corrected the
             record-keeping mistakes. 

             Shamy, at first, denied knowing anything about
             the complaint and then said he would not talk in
             detail about it. "This has nothing to do with my
job
             as prosecutor," Shamy said. 

             According to his written response, Shamy said he
             had his client's verbal permission to use the
             $5,000. 

             ''Respondent (Shamy) was unaware that this
             transaction had to be reduced to writing and
             certainly would have obtained his client's written
             consent had he known that was required," the
             response reads. 

             Shamy's attorney in the matter is E. Ronald
             Wright, a part-time New Brunswick municipal
             judge. Attempts to reach Wright were
             unsuccessful. 

             Shamy started working as a part- time prosecutor
             last June 26 and is paid a base salary of
             $18,000. 

             New Brunswick Mayor James Cahill did not return
             a call for comment about the matter and the city's
             attorney William Hamilton, who appointed Shamy,
             said he learned of the complaint only yesterday
             morning. 

             Hamilton said he was gathering all the relevant
             documents to prepare a report for the mayor. 

             The misappropriation complaint is related to a
             personal injury lawsuit Shamy filed in 1994 as a
             private attorney on behalf of John Ludlow. In
             1997, $125,000 in settlement funds was
             deposited into Shamy's attorney trust account. 

             The Middlesex County Board of Social Services
             then put a lien on Ludlow's settlement, entitling
the
             board to reclaim welfare money it had paid
             Ludlow. 

             On Dec. 1, 1998 -- with $6,747 in Shamy's trust
             account to pay the social services board --
             Shamy wrote himself the $5,000 check to pay for
             Christmas presents, the attorney ethics complaint
             says. 

             Shamy has denied his behavior was egregious
             enough to violate the Wilson Rule, based on a
             1971 state Supreme Court decision, that
             specifically prohibits attorneys from misusing
             clients' money. 

             ''It basically says 'Thou shalt not steal,'"
             Gronikowski said. 

             The complaint also alleges Shamy told the Smart
             Money Mortgage Center he was holding an
             $8,000 gift for Juan and Beatriz Marrero, whom
             he was representing in a real estate purchase. In
             fact, according to the complaint, he was holding
             no gifts for the Marreros, just a $20,000 loan from
             Juan Marrero's trade union. 

             Shamy said in his response that another attorney,
             James Feeney, was holding the gift, and what
             mattered most was that the $8,000 existed, not
             who was holding it. 

             The Office of Attorney Ethics has 15 three-person
             county committees that decide their cases. The
             Mercer County ethics committee, made up of two
             lawyers and one nonlawyer, will meet publicly to
             hear Shamy's case at a Princeton law office on
             June 15. 


-----
Sent using MailStart.com ( http://MailStart.Com/welcome.html )
The FREE way to access your mailbox via any web browser, anywhere!





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:324
Sender:Groovemeister007@...
Post Date/Time:2000-06-06 13:19:26
Subject:Board of Elections letter
Message:

Following is the text of the letter sent by the Peoples' Campaign to
the Board of Elections on June 1.

Groovemeister


NEW BRUNSWICK PEOPLES' CAMPAIGN
C/O FRANK BRIGHT
218 GEORGE STREET
NEW BRUNSWICK, NJ 08901

June 1, 2000

Matthew M. Vaughn
Middlesex County Board of Elections
777 Jersey Avenue
New Brunswick, NJ 08901

Dear Mr. Vaughn:

	I have your letter of May 10, 2000.  Because it utterly
avoided the issues we raised in our letter of April 7, 2000, in which
we petitioned the Board of Elections to override the city-recommended
sites for twelve polling districts in New Brunswick, I will not
dignify your letter by calling it a "response" to mine.

	Your letter contends, and indeed, we concede, that the
decennial census precludes meaningful changes to ward and district
lines this year.  N.J.S.A. 19:4-15.  However, those same election
statutes are equally clear that the selection of polling places is a
separate issue.  Selecting sites for polls is an annual exercise that
must be undertaken regardless of when the Census is taken.  N.J.S.A.
19:8-2 directs municipal clerks to suggest, and the County Board to
select, at specified deadlines in each year, polling places for
elections.  Your suggestion that the taking of the Census precludes
the Board from fulfilling its specific statutory mandate of annually
selecting appropriate polling places calculated to ease all possible
burdens on voting, is absurd.

	The Board's refusal to even consider changes in the location
of the polling places on a wholly unfounded legal rationale  the
taking of the Census this year  is itself arbitrary and
capricious,
and an abuse of the Board's discretion.  Turning to the merits,
we
convincingly demonstrated in our April 7, 2000 letter that the
current polling locations for twelve districts in New Brunswick are
inadequate.  There is no competent evidence known to us, or that has
been presented to the Board, that contradicts the polling places we
recommended, or our rationales supporting each such change.  Again,
the refusal to implement our recommendations is arbitrary,
capricious, and an abuse of discretion.

	Accordingly, we urge the Board to reconsider its decision.
If we do not hear from you by Monday, June 12, 2000, we will have no
choice but to ask a court to set aside these acts and omissions by
the County Board and implement the uncontradicted recommendations of
the Peoples' Campaign as to polling places.

	Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Respectfully submitted,

NEW BRUNSWICK
PEOPLES' CAMPAIGN

By:  /s/ Frank Bright
     FRANK BRIGHT


cc:	Sharon Young, Esq.
	  Attorney General's Office
	Daniel Torrisi,
	  New Brunswick City Clerk





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:325
Sender:Groovemeister007@...
Post Date/Time:2000-06-06 13:29:34
Subject:Election activities tonight
Message:

Members of the Peoples' Campaign will be meeting at 6 pm _SHARP_ 
tonight at 218 Townsend for the purpose of visiting several polling 
places.  This learning exercise is important.  It meant to 
familiarize people with poll sites, new voting machines, and election 
day procedures.  Anyone who will be working on the campaign in ANY 
capacity in November, and anyone who can teach those that will be 
around in November is strongly encouraged to attend, so you can see 
exactly how things are done now, and it is not an entirely new 
experience in November.


Here is the agenda (subject to change)

6:10 Leave 218 Townsend, travel to Redshaw School

6:20 Arrive Redshaw School, meet district board workers, examine 
voting machines, get explanation of how they work, meet challengers, 
examine voting roll books, voting slips, and provisional ballots.

6:50 Exit Redshaw school, scope out 100-foot border from polling 
site, meet any GOTV workers on site.

7:00 Leave for Providence Square poll, where we will go in, look 
around, study surroundings, demarcate 100-foot line, and leave.

7:20 Arrive at Lincoln School

7:30 Study layout of poll site, meet district board workers

7:45 Role-play advising voter of which polling district to go to.

7:55 Talk to campaign / GOTV workers

8:00 Polls close, see how voting results are collected from machines

8:20 Leave for Corzine party at Hyatt.


GROOVEMEISTER

Post ID:326
Sender:"Matthew Smith" <vivaohio@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-06-06 15:18:56
Subject:Electoral Success in Northern Ireland
Message:



>From: RM_Distribution <rmlist-reply@...>
>To: Multiple recipients of RM_Distribution - Sent by 
><rmlist-reply@...>
>Subject: RM000605 Irish news - Holiday Weekend 3-5 June
>Date: Tue, 6 Jun 2000 12:28:11 -0400 (EDT)
>
>     IRISH NEWS ROUND-UP
>     http://irlnet.com/rmlist/
>>
> >>>>>> REPUBLICAN ELECTED MAYOR OF DERRY
>
>
>  Sinn Fein's Cathal Crumley become the first ever Sinn Fein mayor
>  of Derry, the first Sinn Fein mayor of a major irish city since
>  1920.
>
>  Huge crowds attended the city's Guildhall to watch Mr Crumley
>  defeat unionist nominee, Ernie Hamilton by 21 votes to eight to
>  secure a historic victory. He is the first Sinn Fein mayor since
>  the death of Terence MacSwiney - following a hunger strike - in
>  Cork in 1920.
>
>  Ulster Unionist and outgoing deputy mayor, Mr Hamilton was
>  returned for a second term as deputy with the unanimous support
>  of council. Derry councillors abandoned normal procedure last
>  night to permit the huge crowds which attended the city's
>  Guildhall access to the council chamber.
>
>  A former prisoner of war and a blanket protestor at Long kesh
>  jail, Mr Crumley last night pledged to be mayor for all the
>  people of Derry.
>
>  In a miscarriage of justice, Mr Crumley, a father of three, was
>  convicted on the evidence of so-called Derry 'supergrasses' in
>  May 1984 and received nine life sentences and an additional 300
>  years in jail. However, all the convictions were quashed, and Mr
>  Crumley was released from prison in 1986.
>
>  When the result of the vote was announced last night, the new
>  mayor received a standing and prolonged ovation.
>
>  Education minister, Martin McGuinness - who was accompanied by
>  party chairman Mitchel McLaughlin - said Mr Crumley's success was
>  a "great night" for Derry.
>
>  In his acceptance speech, Mr Crumley said his election as mayor
>  closed a long and painful period. He said his election closed the
>  door on the politics of exclusion.
>
>  "The failed politics of exclusion end tonight and I can assure
>  you that during my term of office no-one will be denied their
>  rights. I will be open impartial, fair and pragmatic.
>
>  "I offer the hand of friendship to the unionist community and
>  trust they will have the maturity to react in a reciprocal
>  fashion for the betterment of this city," he said.
>
>
>--------------------------------------------------------------------
>

Post ID:327
Sender:"Louise Ammentorp" <lknesta@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-06-07 12:54:25
Subject:program
Message:

Hi everyone

The campaign seems to be going well. I know everyone is working hard and it 
shows.

I just wanted to let people know that in the program that we made 2000 
copies of, the amendments from the convention did not get in. The platform 
therefore doesn't represent the decisions made there. I did not look over 
the entire thing, but in the case of our position on childcare, it left us 
with a very bad public position and not the one decided by the majority in 
the campaign. The pamphlet otherwise looks great, and it is a powerful piece 
of literature to have.

I just want to make sure that no more of this flyer gets made without the 
updates put in and that it is changed before the newspaper comes out.

In Unity,
Louise
________________________________________________________________________
Get Your Private, Free E-mail from MSN Hotmail at http://www.hotmail.com

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:329
Sender:"Audrey Allred" <audreya99@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-06-07 13:12:35
Subject:from the Steering Committee
Message:

A proposal was brought to the Steering Committee meeting on 5/29/00 to make 
all phone and contact lists collected while canvassing available to everyone 
working on the campaign.

The Steering Committee decided against this proposal for these reasons:
1) Due to the large amount of contact information that has been collected, 
it is virtually impossible to compile a complete list.

2) Having a list of numbers available to all campaign organizers would ruin 
the efficiency of the campaign. If people are receiving a potentially large 
amount of phone calls for various different reasons, they may get confused, 
irritated and discouraged from supporting and working with the campaign.

Instead, every organizer should keep a list of their own contacts and 
develop networks based on that information.

In unity,
Audrey Allred
Steering Committee

________________________________________________________________________
Get Your Private, Free E-mail from MSN Hotmail at http://www.hotmail.com

Post ID:332
Sender:"Matthew Smith" <vivaohio@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-06-08 00:08:43
Subject:Fwd: South Koreans Protest US Bombing Range
Message:



>From: "Vieques Libre" <viequeslibre@...>
>To: List Member <vivaohio@...>
>Subject: South Koreans Protest US Bombing Range
>Date: 7 Jun 2000 10:29:52 -0000
>
>Vieques Libre - http://www.viequeslibre.org
>
>http://dailynews.yahoo.com/h/ap/20000606/wl/skorea_us_military_1.html
>
>Yahoo World Headlines
>Tuesday June 6 11:19 AM ET
>
>Anti-U.S. Protest in South Korea
>
>SEOUL, South Korea (AP) - About 2,000 villagers and activists clashed with
>riot police Tuesday, demanding closure of a U.S. military bombing range on
>South Korea's west coast, police and reports said.
>
>Protesters shouted anti-U.S. slogans as they tried to march into the
>bombing range near Mae Hyang, a village 50 miles southwest of Seoul. They
>threw rocks and wielding sticks and security forces guarding the site,
>police said.
>
>Police, holding plastic shields locked together in front of them, blocked
>the march.
>
>Villagers have long demanded the relocation of the nearby Koon-Ni Range,
>and anti-U.S. protests have increased since early May, when a U.S. fighter
>jet with engine trouble dropped six bombs on the Koon-Ni Range near the
>village.
>
>Villagers claimed that six people were slightly injured and walls were
>cracked and windows shattered by the impact. But U.S. and Korean military
>investigators said the bombs caused no injuries or property damage.
>
>South Korea's Defense Ministry has ruled out moving the base and instead
>intends to relocate 236 homes close to the range to avoid friction - a
>plan opposed by villagers.
>
>``We'll risk our lives to fight until the Koon-Ni range is shut down,''
>Choi Yong-woon, a 45-year-old village leader, was quoted as saying by the
>national news agency Yonhap.
>
>Villagers said one activist was slightly injured in the clashes but police
>could not confirm it. No arrests were made.
>
>Civic and leftist groups have seized on the controversy over the bombing
>range to mount anti-U.S. protests, demanding the withdrawal of U.S. troops
>in South Korea. There are 37,000 American soldiers stationed here under a
>defense treaty.
>
>
>______________________________________________________________________
>To unsubscribe, write to viequeslibre-unsubscribe@...
>______________________________________________________________________
>Start Your Own FREE Email List at http://www.listbot.com
>

________________________________________________________________________
Get Your Private, Free E-mail from MSN Hotmail at http://www.hotmail.com

Post ID:333
Sender:"Zofia Nowakowski" <znowakowski@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-06-08 11:14:34
Subject:Amendments
Message:

These are the amendments made at the convention that we discussed adding to the new pamphlet - these are what I could remember from that day:

1. New Brunswick is a union friendly town, under jobs.
2. Establish a city-run employment center, under jobs.
3. Eliminate red tape and favoritism in the approval and permitting process, under redevelopment.
4. Increase investment in job training so all residents have access to better paying jobs in and outside of New Brunswick., under jobs

5 Childcare amendment: as she points out, Louise put a change forth at a general meeting month(s) before the convention that was approved.  This did not get written into the convention program.

Zofia Nowakowski
Fiscal Policy Institute
218 W 40th St, 3rd Fl
New York, NY 10018
Tel: 212.278.0878
Fax:212.730.1405

Post ID:334
Sender:"Nicole Engel" <snszine@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-06-10 09:55:36
Subject:People's Campaign
Message:

Submitted to NBPeople's Campaign Steering Committee By Joe Smith May 22.

As uniting basis of our campaign, we are agreed to uphold and fight for the 
Platform of Community Control as determined thru results of our door-to-door 
survey.

In our '00  election year strategy, we have agreed to challenge for City 
Council. As against a Political Machine that has, for decades, defeated 
every opposition it has faced. Rather it has expanded to send Machine 
Boss/Former Mayor/Cahill Uncle-John Lynch to the New Jersey Senate where he 
rose to Senate President under the Democratic Florio Administration- the 2nd 
Ranking Democrat in New Jersey.

Parallel Opportunist Sucker Soaries of New Brunswick/Franklin 1st Baptist 
Church turned Whore after the 1991 N.B. Police Murder of resident Shawn 
Potts. "Keeper of the Shawn Potts tree" Soaries parlayed his hustle into 
Nazi Whitman's administration where he's now N.J. Secretary of State, to 
smooth tension from Jack Booted State Police Storm Trooper "Profiling" "Drug 
War" Aggression.

This Political Machine crafted with the best Urban Development 
Strategists/FBI/COINTELPRO methods/experience that Johnson & Johnson's $25 
Billion Annual Revenue International Network can impose. As was put to me 
"We are against a juggernaut."

Can there be any question whatever that our People's Platform for Community 
Control is in complete contradiction to J&J, etc.'s imperialist murderous 
stronghold which it maintains through an experienced, financed Political 
Machine. The same Political Machine that ran Amiri Baraka and others from 
the Rutgers Faculty, that Purged student activists, that drove Assata Shakur 
from the country. (Didn't Cahill molest Shakur when she was the only woman 
locked in the cellar of Middlesex County Courthouse?)

Can anyone who supports our Platform have any question that its victory 
depends entirely on the overthrow of Bosses Cahill & Lynch, of their 
appointments Beltranena and Larkin and the complete defeat of their 
Political Machine? But these questions exist inside our campaign and are the 
biggest danger to our victory.

More dangerous than Bright Frank McCarthy & Compassionate Conservatism, 
Narrow Jim Luceno's Armchair Revolutionaries, NJFO's Constant Sabotage of 
the Elected Board of Ed Campaign, more dangerous is a "People's Candidate" 
who "invents" issues that come more from Nancy Reagan than community 
responses to our survey (Where was "Drug Problem" in our top5? 10? 20?). 
Why? To "invent" Traitor Soaries' Solutions of Cooperating with J&J to solve 
them.(Who but J&J is the biggest drug producer &  distributor in New 
Brunswick?) (Nevermind the N.B. Police!!).

Our campaign calls or organize the people to Seize Power! to solve our own 
problems as we see them.

Curtis Warren, who suddenly announces himself not as Bus Driver, Janitor, 
Maintenance, Handyman, Laborer, etc., but Security for snake Soaries' 1st 
Bobo Church, and Missionary of God-minutes after accepting his candidacy as 
People's Representative, hedges his bet. Professing Unite, Organize, Seize 
Power! to the Convention, Curtis "Say Sellout" Warren switched over bleating 
to the Home News "But we're not here to tear down the Political Machine, 
we're just here to do better."

Nope, Curtis can't get that. We want community control vs. Imperialism. Not 
Jr. Soaries's slick talk.

Confidence in Curtis? We got NADA. "First it is absolutely necessary that 
Revolutionaries and all Anti-imperialist, Radicals and Progressive people 
UNITE in an All People's UNITED FRONT AGAINST THE RIGHT WING & its' Klan 
Nazi Lynch mob Underground, as well as the Corporate Running Dof visible 
forces in Government, Politics, Wall Street Media, Academia, Institutions, 
Organizations!" (Amiri Baraka U&S April 2000)

You want it come get it. My dogs is with it.

                       Block on Lock
                  Revolutionaries Unite!
                Win the Advanced to Communism!

                       Cliff Smith
                       Joe Smith
                       Nester Valdes
                       Samantha Prince (withdrawn!)
                       Jason Hankins

May 29, 2000, at the Steering Committee meeting, Cliff Smith, Joe Smith, 
Nester Valdes and Jason Hankins were suspended from all People's Campaign 
acitivities.

Post ID:335
Sender:"Nicole Engel" <snszine@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-06-10 09:56:39
Subject:Commemoration for Shaun Potts
Message:



1 JULY, 1991, AT 147 REDMOND ST., SHAUN, UNARMED, WAS MURDERED IN COLD BLOOD 
BY NBPO ZANE GRAY.
GRAY, BACKED BY NB MAYOR JAMES CAHILL, NEVER FACED CHARGES.

ALL ARE INVITED TO COMMEMORATE THE ANNIVERSARY OF THE DEATH OF SHAUN "UNITY" 
POTTS.

WHEN: 1:OO PM, 1 JULY, 2000
WHERE: 147 REDMOND ST., NB.

Join us in a walking tour of the history of police brutality in Nu 
Brunzwick.

Saturday, 1 July, we honor the anniversary of the death of Shaun "Unity" 
Potts, at the hands of NB Police, and its cover-up by Mayor James Cahill and 
the County Prosecutor's Office.

We will begin 12:00 noon at the Commercial & Powers St. site of the NB 
Police murder of Carolyn "Sissy" Adams, and mark the route of the original 
"Justice for Unity" march.

Past Feaster Park, down Throop to 147 Redmond for a 1:00 pm commemoration of 
Potts, Adams, and all victims of NB & US police brutality.

Then up Remsen to Baldwin St. where officers Chinchilla and Marshall put a 
$10,000 bounty on the head of every Black man in the city, imposing gestapo 
rule that exists today.

Across Baldwin to Lee, where, days after Potts' murder, NB Police, 
encouraged by Mayor James Cahill, put K-9 attack dogs on Lester Voorhees.

We invite everyone to join this event and raise discussion of vital concerns 
such as:

What to do about police brutality?
What is the meaning of "Community Control Over Police"?
What side is the NB political machine on?
Who are our allies, Who are our enemies?
How did Buster Soaries parlay Potts' death into a position in Gov. Whitman's 
administration?
How should we approach the upcoming elections for NB City Council, NJ 
Senate, and US President?
How should we organize ourselves at a city, state, national, international 
level?

Build the Revolutionary Democratic Workers' Party
Build the United Front Against Imperialism

BLOCK ON LOCK PRODUCTIONS
214-8828

Post ID:336
Sender:"Nicole Engel" <snszine@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-06-10 09:57:21
Subject:People's Campaign
Message:

Is Communism divisive? or Who are the Peoples' Enemies?

Does the Peoples' Campaign Steering Committee stand with the attempts by 
Steering Committee member Frank Bright to slander Board of Education 
Campaign Coordinator Joe Smith, to sabotage the Campaign for an Elected 
Board of Education, and to subvert the democratic vote of the Peoples' 
Convention?

Bright, claiming to lead the democratic petty middle class of N.B., having 
lost his challenge to J. Smith's coordination of the Peoples' Campaign for 
an Elected Board of Education with his nomination of Jim Luceno (who 
succeeded in formalizing the internal opposition where NJFO failed in its 
nomination of Zofia Nowakowski) has switched in his accusing Smith of 
"divisiveness" to anti-democratic methods of advancing his position. Does 
Bright represent the Steering Committee in his attack on Joe?

The people of New Brunswick, understanding their condition, responded to our 
survey that the education system in New Brunswick was the most important 
issue in the city.

The Peoples' Convention, recognizing this mandate and recognizing Joe 
Smith's unquestionable production toward a democratic Peoples' Education 
System formalized Joe's leadership of this struggle placing him, as 
Coordinator, on the Strategic and Tactical Committees.

For Bright, after Joe's victory, to attack Joe as being "divisive to the 
campaign" not only slanders Joe and undermines the decision of the 
convention, but actually, from his position on the Steering Committee, 
attempts to provoke attacks on the Campaign and is himself being divisive.

To succeed, our platform must have the uncompromising support of the 
steering committee which demands that they address themselves to Bright's 
accusation.

No doubt the people's control over education divides most clearly the 
representatives of the people from the representatives of imperialism. To 
succeed, our campaign must establish which is which.

                                  Cliff Smith
                                  Joe Smith
                                  Nicole Engel
                                  Angela Jackson
                                  Samantha Prince

Post ID:338
Sender:"Nicole Engel" <snszine@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-06-10 10:26:44
Subject:Overthrow Cahill!
Message:


OVERTHROW CAHILL!
TEAR DOWN J&J'S POLITICAL MACHINE!

BEWARE THE PEOPLE'S CAMPAIGN SELLOUT!

     Without doubt the world condition of the people vs. imperialism demands 
that we Seize Power! and take Community Control! as against the corporate 
dictatorship of international monopoly. This 6/10 of 1% (.006) of the 
population maintains rule thru its political machine apparatus globally and 
locally.

     From its New Brunswick World HQ, billion dollar Drug Kingpin J&J 
designs apartheid poverty from South Africa to George St.  As we build the 
revolutionary democratic movement against this Nazi World Order, we must 
immediately overthrow its local agents and TEAR DOWN ITS NATIVE POLITICAL 
MACHINE! Cahill/Lynch, puppet city council, appointed police director 
Beltranena, appointed Board of Education and superintendent Larkin must be 
put out and their apparatus demolished. This is the meaning of the People's 
Call "Community Control!", claimed by the "People's Campaign", and also the 
minimum, democratic level of revolutionary politics.

     But as we Overthrow Cahill & co., what is to be made of "People's 
Candidate" Curtis Warren's pitch to co-operate with J&J and join its 
political machine? And "People's Campaign" manager Xavier Hansen's sorry 
damage control talk of "front line"(!)"unity" with the political machine 
from the treacherous trenches of Highland Park?

     No, we must shadow these petty pretenders and expose their opportunist 
positions. Warren, Hansen, and "People's Campaign" Steering Committee have 
violated the democratic Campaign slogans Community Control! Seize Power! Put 
People First! This is and insult and slander to everyone who answered our 
survey, a sabotage of our campaign, an attempt to demoralize and disrupt the 
New Brunswick People's Revolutionary Democratic Movement.

     More clear by the day that only working class, communist leadership can 
represent the whole people against imperialism. We play the hand before us 
and support all tendencies against J&J/Cahill,etc., but we build the 
Revolutionary Democratic Workers' Party toward People's Democracy, 
Socialism, Communism.

Seize City Council!
Win the Elected Board of Education!
All Eyes on "People's Campaign"!
Down with Imperialism!

Block on Lock Productions. What?
214-8828




________________________________________________________________________
Get Your Private, Free E-mail from MSN Hotmail at http://www.hotmail.com

Post ID:339
Sender:"kristina bas" <KRISBAS@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-06-10 13:48:25
Subject:Re: [nbpeoplescampaign] Amendments
Message:

to clarify my amendments, under jobs:

the city should give priority in city contracts to unionized firms, as well 
as support unionization among the city's workers.

Kristina

>From: "Zofia Nowakowski" <znowakowski@...>
>Reply-To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>To: nbpeoplescampaign@egroups.com
>Subject: [nbpeoplescampaign] Amendments
>Date: Thu, 08 Jun 2000 11:14:34 -0400
>
>These are the amendments made at the convention that we discussed adding to 
>the new pamphlet - these are what I could remember from that day:
>
>1. New Brunswick is a union friendly town, under jobs.
>2. Establish a city-run employment center, under jobs.
>3. Eliminate red tape and favoritism in the approval and permitting 
>process, under redevelopment.
>4. Increase investment in job training so all residents have access to 
>better paying jobs in and outside of New Brunswick., under jobs
>
>5 Childcare amendment: as she points out, Louise put a change forth at a 
>general meeting month(s) before the convention that was approved.  This did 
>not get written into the convention program.
>
>Zofia Nowakowski
>Fiscal Policy Institute
>218 W 40th St, 3rd Fl
>New York, NY 10018
>Tel: 212.278.0878
>Fax:212.730.1405

Post ID:340
Sender:"Tracey Luszcz" <traceyx@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-06-10 15:25:58
Subject:Re: Overthrow Cahill!
Message:

This attack on the People's Campaign in New Brunswick is a frightening 
throwback to earlier issues of UNS. Meaning it's hard to read, it's 
extremely left wing and dogmatic and filled with slogans that don't mean 
anything. Who is revolutionary enough in your eyes to tear down the machine 
and demolish the apparatus? What are you basing your accusations on? What 
does the fact that X lives in Highland Park have to do with anything? This 
type of politicking is only going to isolate you further and further away 
from the revolutionary movement. I sincerely hope you don't intend to go 
door to door telling the people of New Brunswick how un-revolutionary the 
People's Campaign is. That's what the people you're so intent on demolishing 
and tearing down usually paid people to do in the past.

anotha'


Arthouse ARTHOUSE ARTHOUSE ARTHOUSE ARTHOUSE ARTHOUSE ARTHOUSE ARTHOUSE

               Is cause we don't have a space we don't have no paid art 
staff we don't have the community institutions we got a f____in' mall we got 
atari we got smut on the internet

Come out and rhyme all night with fabulous hosts at 559 Hamilton. We open 
our doors to all you conscious hip happenin' peops who thinks we can't just 
sleep on the disturbinz (like blintz) we can't snooze at the altar of 
superstructural wavemakin' we can't fake our fake cultural orgasms at 
cheezzy played out moviehouse shuffle shell out $7 who the hell is Quentin 
Tarantino anyway we don't need no Jackie Brown we got great creativity we 
got ourselves and our cultural struggle to wage writ large all over the fake 
paper tiger walls put up between ourselves, within ourselves. LEt's do 
this....

ARthouse 559 @ 559 Hamilton st. just outside of NB, across from Krauszer's 
deli and scratch tickets. (Leave your scratch tickets outside my house!)  
Open mike, special features, be progressive, bring your music, poems, words, 
attitude, whatever...Starts at 9pm, goes til late, come around back and 
bring $5 to benefit the People's Campaign to elect a real city council in 
NB. More info, call 732 729 0873

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:342
Sender:"Zofia Nowakowski" <znowakowski@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-06-12 14:22:10
Subject:RE:
Message:

I think one important issue that is behind our difficulties is that we havent addressed an approach to maintaining candidate's accountability to the campaign.  This is a next step.  Creating a democratic  accountability structure has not been done before so we are starting from scratch.  We all have said that we dont want our candidates to sell out at any point, thinking of once they get in office, and those we chose we have firm belief in them that they wont.  Is this enough at this point?  What do we expect a call for accountability to look like as we move forward?  Do we demand/expect that people make this call in a general meeting?  If we demand unity in the campaign do we ask that we not make our inital call a public attack, but more low key so as not to detract from the campaign and only move into the public realm once it is certain that the differences are irreconcilable with the campaign points, or that somewhere a mistake was not made or someone was not intentionally misquoted with the thought to divide and conquer? At what point are  we a ball and chain around our  candidates legs and at what point are we keeping the campaign accountable?  And if we create an accountability procedure, how can we make sure that it is not a bureaucratic nightmare or a reliance on someone knowing someone else - because alot of people don't know the organizers in the campaign well.

Zofia Nowakowski
Fiscal Policy Institute
218 W 40th St, 3rd Fl
New York, NY 10018
Tel: 212.278.0878
Fax:212.730.1405

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:344
Sender:"Zofia Nowakowski" <znowakowski@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-06-14 11:25:34
Subject:Jobs Polls
Message:

From: 	"Greg LeRoy" <goodjobs@...>
To:	"Me" <goodjobs@...>
Date: 	6/13/00 5:52PM
Subject: 	Two Excellent Polls


Two excellent polls released last week reveal strong continuing public
concern over declining job quality in the U.S.  The first, released by the
National Alliance for Fair Employment, finds that two out of three Americans
consider it unfair when contingent workers are paid lower wages than
full-timers doing the same work at the same level. Six out of ten said they
were more likely to vote for a candidate who backs legislation to require
companies to pay part-time, contract or temporary employees the same rate of
pay and benefits as regular employees. See the poll at:

www.fairjobs.org/report/poll.php

The second, released by Jobs for the Future, finds that a whopping *94%* of
Americans agree that people who work full-time should be able to earn enough
to keep their families out of poverty (80% agree strongly). And 77% believe
that government should help people leaving welfare get good jobs that offer
opportunities for advancement and the chance to remain self-sufficient. Only
19% believe people should be moved into jobs as quickly as possible
regardless of the jobs' potential.  Asked how much a family of four needs to
"make ends meet," 69% said at least $35,000 a year -- more than twice the
federal poverty level for such a household! See this poll at:

www.jff.org/whatsnew.html

Greg LeRoy -- Good Jobs First
www.goodjobsfirst.org

Zofia Nowakowski
Fiscal Policy Institute
218 W 40th St, 3rd Fl
New York, NY 10018
Tel: 212.278.0878
Fax:212.730.1405

Post ID:345
Sender:"Nicole Engel" <snszine@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-06-14 12:13:39
Subject:Block on Lock Expelled
Message:


To: NBPeople's Campaign Steering Committee
Regarding: Block on Lock Expelled

Last nite, Tuesday 13th June, I (Nicole Engel) received a phone call from 
Xavier Hansen, saying that the steering committee had unanimously voted to 
expel Block on Lock Productions from the People's Campaign and that I should 
consider myself barred from all campaign activities.

I am requesting on behalf of Block on Lock, that the steering committee send 
us a written document stating their action and the basis for it.

Nicole Engel
(Block on Lock)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:350
Sender:Louise Ammentorp <lknesta@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-06-15 00:46:29
Subject:Re: [nbpeoplescampaign] Block on Lock Expelled
Message:

This statement was drafted by myself,  the Steering Committee of the People's Campaign
voted unanimously to support the expulsion of Block on Lock.
About Block on Lock
or who is selling out?

For the first time in memory residents of New Brunswick have begun to organize and
mobilize to seize control of government and begin to take control over their lives.
We have built for the first time a multi-national united front of Afro-Americans,
Latinos, and Euro-Americans uniting workers, students, professionals and other
segments of the middle class into an organization.  The People's Campaign represents
the first serious threat to the unchallenged domination of the city machine and the
giant corporations that back it. At this historic moment, when the people of New
Brunswick have finally begun to stretch out their arms and flex their muscles after a
long sleep, Block on Lock Productions takes up the job of attacking the people's
organization.  Block on Lock has done the only thing the City Machine can not do to
us, Block on Lock has called the Campaign a "sellout".  The have done the only job
that Cahil and all the other puppets of Johnson and Johnson in city government could
not do. We do not know if Block on Lock has been paid for their efforts.
      Block on Lock  has begun distributing literature attacking the People's Campaign
in general and the steering committee, our campaign manger, and our candidates in
particular.  The People's Campaign upholds everyone participating in the campaign's
right to criticize, question and discuss actions of the Campaign. We can not tolerate
member organizations slandering and viciously attacking our campaign. For these
reasons all members of Block on Lock Productions should be immediately expelled from
our organization.



Nicole Engel wrote:

> To: NBPeople's Campaign Steering Committee
> Regarding: Block on Lock Expelled
>
> Last nite, Tuesday 13th June, I (Nicole Engel) received a phone call from
> Xavier Hansen, saying that the steering committee had unanimously voted to
> expel Block on Lock Productions from the People's Campaign and that I should
> consider myself barred from all campaign activities.
>
> I am requesting on behalf of Block on Lock, that the steering committee send
> us a written document stating their action and the basis for it.
>
> Nicole Engel
> (Block on Lock)
>

Post ID:353
Sender:"Paul McGee" <shorepaulie@...>

Subject:REMINDER!! ARTHOUSE OUTSIDE SATURDAY 6/17

There are plans in the works to put all New Brunswick
Pre-K and K students with outside companies!  Read:
private, non-union, uncertified and low paid teachers.
Current teachers will be moved to other grades.
Many parents are upset that their little ones will be
bussed, or not with the teachers that they know and
trust.
Can anyone attend the meeting and keep us posted?

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:361
Sender:"Zofia Nowakowski" <znowakowski@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-06-19 10:28:33
Subject:School update
Message:

More info regarding the K and Pre-K privatization issue:

The NB BOE is currently  filing suit against the state regarding their lack of supplemental funds for the rest of the district, related to the Abbott v. Burke funds the City is due.  There is an overcrowding problem since the City has not gotten its money - $8M alone in pre-K funds. More students must be enrolled b/c of A v B. Last year, 4 year olds were enrolled for 1/2 day (Abbott v Burke requires that 3 yrs on up be in all-day pre-K programs). Next year, the program must include 3 year olds, and 400 are registered.  The City was planning to lease space in trailers, buy properties buy the State has dragged their feet and prevented them from doing this. So privatization is a poor response to this overcrowding problem.  Certification for daycare centers providing daycare (HeadSart is just one provider) is being made more stringent and brought in line w/state standards, however, staff who were noncertified before receiving contracts have been grandfathered in.

Zofia Nowakowski
Fiscal Policy Institute
218 W 40th St, 3rd Fl
New York, NY 10018
Tel: 212.278.0878
Fax:212.730.1405





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:362
Sender:"Louise Ammentorp" <lknesta@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-06-19 13:40:49
Subject:Re: [nbpeoplescampaign] School update
Message:

Zofia
just so you know, the city gave school space to the  Brunswick charter 
school instead of letting them find somewhere else to go (they are a 
regional charter school)even before they got there approval(!). The state is 
not wholly to blame. the city has not done enough to fight for this funding 
nor to use current funding to build space for these programs. They are very 
happy to instead pay private entities big money for the space.
furthermore we want standards above state standards, we want NAEYC (National 
Assoication for Education of Young Children)standards for childcare.

Post ID:364
Sender:"Louise Ammentorp" <lknesta@...>
Post Date/Time:2000-06-19 15:28:01
Subject:childcare
Message:

Here is a rough draft of the program. Please let me know if anyone has 
additions or changes.

Quality public childcare for all infants through pre-k children in New 
Brunswick. To ensure accountability and equity in the quality of the care, 
this should take place within public school system with union teachers 
certified in early childhood, age appropriate facilities, small class size 
and low teacher-student ratio.
________________________________________________________________________
Get Your Private, Free E-mail from MSN Hotmail at http://www.hotmail.com
